data.title: Social Security Numbers and Fidelity TFIN s Temporary Federal ID No
data.description: Social Security Numbers and Fidelity TFIN s Temporary Federal ID No i. When an employee is sent to Fidelity they confirm the SSN on the employee record is valid with the SSA based on the name. If the employee s SSN and name do not match the employee s account is not set up at Fidelity and an error is generated.ii. Retirement then provides the error information to HR Data Integrity who reviews and decides if there is a corrected SSN or if a dummied SSN is needed 999 .iii. If a dummied SSN is provided the PeopleSoft assigns a TFIN and sends an SSN Change record to Fidelity.iv. There are currently over 900 employees with Fidelity TFIN s assigned.v. Although the process is working it causes a lot of extra manual review. In addition it causes confusion for the employee s having a TFIN as their SSN.vi. Joanne Stafford is currently reviewing this process for Optimus.vii. Recommended solution:1 STRONGLY RECOMMEND Consideration of SSN validation at time of hire to minimize number of Fidelity TFIN s required.

data.title: Ability to capture Original Start Date
data.description: Displays the earliest date that this job data record emplID ERN instance was associated with the organization. The date is provided by default from the effective date of the job record with an action of Hire, Add Contingent Worker, or Add POI Instance. This is not the date the job was created in the system, like the Date Created field on the Work Location page. You can override this date to enter an earlier start date, for example if the person has previously worked for the company or an affiliate or, depending upon company policies, for special cases like jobs with probationary periods, mergers and acquisitions, and so on. Original Start Date needs manual adjustment due to errors in conversion or other date issues such as hire date error. When employee type changes from Temp to Regular, Original start date does not change. When employee is rehired, Original start date does not change. When employee transfers from one company to another FEIN change , Original start date does not change. When employee changes job position, Original start date does not change.

data.title: Ability to capture Last Day Worked
data.description: Termination Date, Last Date Worked, and Override Last Date Worked The system displays the day before the termination effective date as the termination date and the date last worked. These fields display when you have indicated an action that will inactivate or suspend a job. If you rehire the person, the system deselects these fields. When a person returns from leave, the system deselects only the Last Date Worked field. If the date is not accurate, select Override Last Date Worked to enter the date. When an employee is on a leave row, it will capture the last date worked ability to be overridden

data.title: Ability to capture Expected Return Date
data.description: This date is used as the expected return date for an employee on LOA LOA team uses this for record report but this date is moving date and can change multiple times. A row is inserted every time this date changes.

data.title: Ability to capture Expected Job End Date
data.description: Enter the end date or return date for this job, if known. If you don t know the date initially, you can enter it later. If this job is a temporary assignment and you do not enter a date in the Expected Job End Date field, you can run the Temporary Assignment w out End Date report to identify those assignments that do not have an end date. This date is necessary if you want the system to terminate this job and reactivate any substantive job that may be on hold. The system displays the day before the termination effective date as the termination date.

data.title: Ability to capture Last Start Date
data.description: Displays the most recent start date for this organization instance. The system populates this field originally with the effective date of the controlling instance s job data row with the action of HIR and then refreshes it with the effective date of job data rows with the actions REH for employees or RNW for contingent workers . This date is different from the first start date if this organization instance has been inactive and then reactivated. Rehire date If someone is reinstated, an employee s last start date will be populated from previous employment as if they never left the organization Details: Last Start Date is not manually adjusted. When employee type changes from Temp to Regular, Last Start Date does not change When employee is rehired, Last Start Date defaults to the effective date of rehire. When employee transfers from one company to another FEIN change , Last Start Date does not change When employee changes job position, Last Start Date does not change.

data.title: Ability to capture Position Entry Date
data.description: When you enter a position number for this person, the system populates this field with the effective date and this field becomes unavailable for entry. You can override the default by clicking the Override Position Data button. If you are entering a transaction that returns a person to active status from an inactive status, the system will populate the field with the effective date of that transaction. For example, if you are rehiring a person as of September 1, 2014, the field will update to reflect this rehire date. If an employee is terminated and rehired, the date defaults to the rehire date If an employee is globally transferred, the date defaults to the transfer date If the employee changes jobs positions, the date defaults to the date of the change If the employee moves from temp to reg vice versa , the date defaults to the date of the change If an employee is terminated and reinstated, the date should revert back to date before term

data.title: Ability to capture Benefits Service Date
data.description: All dates default to reinstatement date last start date but it can be overridden to another date for a different entitlement for vacation. Rehire resets to current start date If you come back within 90 days for non union you can be reinstated, depends on contract language for union Used for benefits such as vacation, sick, float. This is a very important date for AM absence management If an employee is terminated and rehired, the date defaults to the rehire date If an employee is globally transferred, the date does not change If the employee changes jobs positions, the date does not change If the employee moves from temp to reg vice versa , the date defaults to the date of the change If an employee is terminated and reinstated, the date should revert back to date before term

data.title: Ability to capture Company Seniority Date
data.description: Can be overridden for premium calculations, calculates length of service within the enterprise. Service is not typically bridged over and would reset when rehired. SLIM override premium calculation If an employee is terminated and rehired, the date defaults to the rehire date If an employee is globally transferred, the date does not change If the employee changes jobs positions, the date does not change If the employee moves from temp to reg vice versa , the date does not change If an employee is terminated and reinstated, the date should revert back to date before term

data.title: Ability to capture Service Award date
data.description: Your anniversary date, if you never leave it is your original start date. If you leave and come back then most often it is the rehire date it can vary . This date is used for Anniversary pins and service award gifts. This can also be negotiated for grandfathered dates The Service Award date can be manually adjusted. HR can bridge the service for anniversary awards. When employee changes from Temp to Regular, service award date resets to the effective date of the change. When employee is rehired, service award date resets to the effective date of Rehire. When employee transfers from one company to another different FEIN , service award does not change. When employee changes job position, service award does not change.

data.title: Ability to capture Labor Agreement Entry Date
data.description: Effective date employee was put into labor agreement. Labor agreement default date does not change defaults , on an effective date on the job record this can be changed, other actions taken to overridden entitlements request screenshot of what this looks like when being updated important to contracts and functionality is available to set up what s needed As a primary rule this date does not change Some contract language allows for the change of this date under certain circumstances All things wages and benefits related is impacted by this date. It determines the level of the contract that an employee is entered in employee category in PS today , negotiated contract date, determines wage scale, leave entitlements, other elements that are negotiated in that contract. If an employee is terminated and rehired, the date defaults to the rehire date If an employee is globally transferred, the date stays the same If the employee changes jobs positions, the date stays the same If the employee moves from temp to reg vice versa , the date stays the same If an employee is terminated and reinstated, the date should revert back to date before term The labor agreement entry date is equal to the last hire date and business has the capability to adjust this date based on their own needs

data.title: Ability to capture grade step entry date
data.description: Effective date employee was put into grade step. Most important for calculating step progression for employees who are in a lapsed time progression schedule and lapsed time premiums If an employee is terminated and rehired, the date defaults to the rehire date If an employee is globally transferred, the date defaults to the transfer date If the employee changes jobs positions, the date defaults to the date of the change If the employee moves from temp to reg vice versa , the date defaults to the date of the change If an employee is terminated and reinstated, the date should revert back to date before term

data.title: Ability to capture job entry date
data.description: Effective date employee was put into job. If an employee moves from temporary to regular or vice versa , this date defaults to the effective date of the change If an employee is rehired, this date defaults to Rehire date If an employee goes into a job, leaves, then comes back into that same job they get their seniority for that job receive credit for working in that job before Used by the business to recognize full service in the job and accumulated units

data.title: Ability to capture Union Seniority Date
data.description: ABS uses this date to track the time they have been in a specific bargaining unit, can be manually adjusted dependent on time in out of bargaining unit. Can be overridden for premium calculations. This date is used by the business if there s any type of layoffs or RIFs, job bids or vacation bids. Details: The Union Seniority date can be manually adjusted. HR and Labor relations will advice if employee s USD needs to change. When employee changes from Temp to Regular, employee may get a new USD or may retain the USD if employee belongs in the same union. This all depends on the CBA. When employee is rehired, USD is reset to the effective date of Rehire. HR and Labor relations will advice if USD needs to change. When employee transfers from one company to another different FEIN , USD resets to the effective date of transfer. When employee changes job position, USD remains the same if the employee is in the same union. Otherwise, USD is reset to the effective date of change.

data.title: General Wage Increases GWI specific to Shaw s
data.description: Currently this is for non union hourly retail employees only does not fall under Grade Step Progressions. There are two components to the wage increase at Shaw s: 1 90 Day increase for New Hires only These are one time increases and rehires are not eligible There will be an associated action action reason that will be used for this transaction PAY GWI in current state New hires that receive a rate change due to promotions or off cycle merits are ineligible. These rate changes are tracked using action action reason PAY MER in current state GWI date Seniority date for new hires will remain as the hire date unless a pay rate change occurs 2 Yearly Flat Amount General Wage Increase Employees will receive the yearly GWI increase on completion of a year from their last GWI date increase A General Wage Increase seniority date will also need to be configured to determine eligibility and when the increases need to take effect. This will be solutioned and designed as part of the Core HR configuration. If an employee is on an LOA at the time of getting a GWI increase, it will need to be put on hold until they return.

data.title: Step Progression rules based on Across the Board ATB increases
data.description: Across the board increases do not take effect until the ceiling step is reached. Once the employee reaches the ceiling step, they are eligible for a yearly ATB increase. Here are the different types of ATB increases: CBA with Across the Board Increase ATB CBAs with Across the Board increase and Grade Ladders with a single step CBAs with Across the Board Increase and Grade Ladders with Rate Increments CBAs with Across the Board Increase based on length of service and Grade Ladders with Rate Increments CBAs with Across the Board Increase and Contract Minimum Wage CMW Detailed scenarios and examples have been captured in the ATB and GWI Scenarios document attached to this ticket. Note: This ticket does not reference the Shaw s GWI requirement which is different.

data.title: Interim Job Step Progression Rules
data.description: When an employee is placed in an interim role, the hours worked in the role should to tracked in order to progress from one step to the next step. There are currently only two interim jobs: Food Clerk Special Progression 13044 Produce Clerk Special Progression 13174 When an employee gets promoted, they are placed in the interim job and the appropriate step in the interim job. From thereon, the employee will progress upon meeting the necessary criteria to progress in the interim scale. Once the employee has reached the ceiling step in the interim scale, they are moved out of the interim job and placed in the non interim regular job.

data.title: Mid Week Progressions
data.description: Certain contracts that are based on hours worked require the progressions to be effective on the date the employee becomes eligible. Since Payroll hours become available a week later, all the updates are retroactive. Therefore, a manual process is done in current state to identify the day of the week an employee meets the hours to progress to the next step and then update the assignment record using that effective date. Need to assess if this process will continue to be manual in future state or if it can be automated.

data.title: Step Progression rules that involve the progression criteria to carry over from one step to the next step
data.description: Progression criteria Days, Hours Worked, etc. will carry over from one step to the next step. For example: Criteria for Step 1: First 90 days Criteria for Step 2: Next 780 Hours Criteria for Step 3: Next 780 Hours If an Employee in above labor agreement works 100 hours in their first 90 days, in order to progress to step 2, they need to work the hours in the next step less the 100 hours from their first 90 days. So to progress to step 2 they would need to work 680 hours 780 100 The carryover progression will function as a part of the overall progression rule that could include the following components: 1 Hybrid progression combination of days, weeks, months, hours worked, etc. 2 Factor in any rules pertaining to LOA 3 Contract minimum wages 4 Automatic progression without manual intervention

data.title: Ensure address validations are in place for coexist
data.description: In the current PeopleSoft system address has restrictions on type, length and address lines. Lot of these were dictated by vendor restrictions. However Cloud does not have these restrictions. This ticket is to ensure necessary changes are implemented in Coexist model to support below changes related to addresses and more importantly ensure necessary changes are implemented to the integrations in PeopleSoft. Address lines should not have special characters only letters, numbers, periods, and hyphens .

data.title: Stop Employees from Progressing when they reach their Ceiling Step
data.description: Employees should not be able to automatically progress from one grade to another. The progression rules should only enable employees to progress from one step to the next until they reach the ceiling step. Once the ceiling step is reached, the employee will continue to be in that step until a promotion job change results in the employee being placed in a different grade. Currently, a frozen exception flag is used to manually flag employees from not progressing.

data.title: Handling Rehires Issuing Credits and Adjusting the Step Entry Date
data.description: A manual process is performed to pull the list of rehires within a specific date range and provide credits based on the contract specifications. The Step entry date is also manually adjusted. Based on the rules for each contract labor agreement, credits are issued by factoring in the following parameters: Historical data dating back to the original hire date A list of comparable and non comparable jobs rehire credits will not apply to non comparable jobs Calculating the duration between every termination and rehire record Total active days from date of hire Based on the duration between the term and rehire, the contract will specify if the employee is eligible for a rehire credit. This is done on every rehire term record. Different contracts have different conditions for how the rehire credits need to be issued.

data.title: Step Progression Rules based on Hire Date Elapsed Time
data.description: Employees should progress from one step to another based on time elapsed from the Hire date. The time elapsed may include a hybrid model that involves both days and months.

Twice a year employees from the Southern California division are expected to fill out a form and send to AEC where Joanne s team has to update this field in PS. data.title: New Process for Talent Reviews in Oracle Groups that don t do Talent Reviews
data.description: Current: Some divisions do not do talent reviews and do not have a process in place. Future: The talent review process will occur inside the system. It will involve administrative work for the HRM, such as setting up plans, talent review meetings, and adding participants. So what: This is additional work for the HRMs that have not done talent reviews historically. They will need to understand the process in Oracle.

data.title: New Process for Talent Reviews in Oracle Divisions that currently do Talent Reviews will require training
data.description: Current: Some divisions do talent reviews. They occur outside of the system and involve several steps, including updating spreadsheets, pre populating data in PeopleSoft, etc. It is a lot of administrative work. Future: The talent review process will occur inside the system. It will involve administrative work for the HRM, such as setting up plans, talent review meetings, and adding participants. So what: Although the talent review process in Oracle still has a fair amount of administrative work for HRMs, it is less work than tracking outside of the system. This will cut down work for HRMs who have been doing talent reviews.

Currently paygroups 028,029,018,019 i.e. Socal ABS, Vons, Portland have access to this custom page. the custom page is only available to Managers and HR Staff under pay groups 028, 029, 018 and 019. The user completes the online form and prints it to share with EE.

data.title: The duration of a PIP cannot be changed once the document is created and approved by HR
data.description: Current: PIP dates can be flexible. Future: Once a PIP document is created and approved by HR, the duration cannot be changed. For example, if the manager creates a 90 day PIP and later decides that the duration needs to be shortened to 60 days, oracle does not allow you to do so. If the duration needs to be extended, the manager can always create a new PIP document for the extended duration. So what: There is less flexibility around the duration of a PIP. I need to set the right duration of the PIP at the time of document creation. If I need to extend the duration, I need to create a new PIP document.

data.title: Add Course Effective Date Functionality
data.description: Currently OLC has a course start and end date. The course start date makes the course active and the course end date make the course in active. In our business we release new courses that are target for new learners. Typically due to payroll constraints we do not make an existing associate complete the new course. This process forces us to create a new course audience instead of using the existing position audience. For example a new course on produce freshness would not be assigned to the 10,000 existing produce associates but would be assigned to new learners. To implement this request we would need to create new audience for the Produce freshness assigned to all produce clerks with a start date after 11.13.20

data.title: Ability to capture GWI date for Shaw s employees
data.description: PS currently has a GWI date field that is used for Shaw s employees. It is currently only applicable to non union hourly retail employees. The GWI Date should default to the date of hire for new hires If a Pay rate change occurs, the GWI date should get updated to the Effective date of the pay rate change. The only exception is if the pay rate change is a minimum wage adjustment identified in current state using PAY MIN and PAY RSM, the GWI date should not get updated When an employee is on a LOA, the GWI date should not get updated until they return from the LOA

data.title: There will be a standard 90 day timeframe for PIPs
data.description: Current: Different groups have different timeframes for PIPs in which an employee must show improvement. Ranges from 30 90 days. Future: Standard stage gates will be at 30 and 60 days. The overall timeframe is in 90 days. Unless there is an exception, if an employee does not improve substantially at 90 days, they will likely be terminated So what: More consistency in timeframe for PIPs, which will make the process more standard and fair. Oracle cannot default to a number of days, the manager has to manually enter the dates and create the check ins. This will need significant understanding.

data.title: PIP Documents will have consistent formatting across the organization
data.description: Current: Different divisions and groups across the organization use their own PIP documents Future: There will be a standardized set of documents for everyone to use, which can be found on Oracle. So what: More consistency across documents used for PIPs, which will make the overall process more consistent and fair.

data.title: PIP will not be directly linked to your Performance Rating
data.description: Current: Some divisions have PIPs linked directly to performance ratings. For example, if an employee is rated a certain rating, they will automatically receive a PIP Future: PIPs should be able to occur anytime, and shouldn t be directly linked to your Performance Rating if you get a certain rating, it doesn t mean that a PIP will be automatically triggered . So what: There may be more ambiguity over what type of performance would receive a PIP, but it also prevents a negative association with performance reviews.

data.title: Development goals will be categorized by experience, exposure, and education
data.description: Current: N A Future: Development goals will fall under 3 categories: experience, exposure, and education So what: More guidance and consistency over development goals. Associates will need to understand what the categories entail.

data.title: Job descriptions will be carried over for backfill roles
data.description: Current: Ability to edit job descriptions leads to inconsistent job descriptions Future: Job descriptions will be locked for backfill roles So what: This will prevent job descriptions from being inconsistent and will save time for the employee that creates and posts the job requisition

data.title: Professional Recruiters or TA Administrators will post requisitions
data.description: Current: Lack of standardized process around posting requisitions the task frequently falls on Division HRBP Future: Professional recruiters or TA Admins will post all requisitions. Pipeline and evergreen will be done centrally by TA admins So what: This will remove tasks from the Division HRBPs Some HRBPs are also professional recruiters

data.title: HRBPs will only post job requisitions on an exception basis
data.description: Current: Lack of standardized process around posting requisitions the task frequently falls on Division HRBP Future: Posting requisitions will be pushed to Site Support and regional HR will only post on an exception basis So what: This will save time for the HRBP HRBP approves, Professional Recruiters post, but sometimes that position is one in the same.

data.title: Ability to see breakdown of where tickets are resolved
data.description: Current: N A Future: Ability to run a report to see what of tickets are solved in what Tier 0, 1, 2, 3 So what: Opportunity for analysis on effectiveness of service catalog and different tiers

data.title: Knowledge Base Management will be standardized
data.description: Current: Some KBs are written in too much detail and are not managed in a standardized fashion Future: Need to determine how knowledge is managed Include intended audience, use SSO deep links, etc. So what: Extra step to ensure that knowledge is managed in a standardized and user friendly manner.

data.title: There will be One Best Way for Ranking Employees in Succession Planning
data.description: Current: Some divisions do a forced ranking of employees on a succession plan Future: There will be One Best Way for succession planning, which may not include forced ranking So what: Divisions will need to change the way they do succession planning

data.title: Accommodation Requests will have a centralized approach
data.description: Current: Accommodation Requests are done differently throughout the org Future: There will be a standardized and centralized approach for accommodation requests So what: Increased standardization and efficiency in managing accommodation requests Post Wave 1

data.title: LOA will be on a centralized system
data.description: Current: DC Manufacturing and Legacy Safeway uses Sedgewick for LOA. Associates contact Sedgewick directly, and Local HR is not involved until they are notified. Future: Everyone will be on a centralized system Associates are encouraged to submit a request through the help desk, and a centralized leave team will process the request. So what: Impacted associates will not need to contact Sedgewick directly. This will make the process easier and save time. This is not part of Optimus and will be centralized by August, prior to Optimus Go Live.

data.title: AEC will drive employee verification
data.description: Current : AEC and Third Party does employee verification, but HR frequently is involved. Equifax with work number. Future : The AEC will be responsible for driving the process of employee verification so HR will not be responsible for employee verification. So what : HR will spend less time on employee verification, which will free them up to do more strategic work. color: ff5630 Need to verify if this is correct color

data.title: Relocation will be tracked in Oracle
data.description: Current: Relocation for associates is tracked manually in a spreadsheet. Future: Relocation will be tracked in Oracle So what: Better data tracking and less work for HRBPs

data.title: Need a solution for mass hiring employees for J1s, strikes, and other seasonal hiring needs
data.description: PeopleSoft currently has a bolt on for mass hiring employees in the event that union employees go on strike or seasonal requirements require a rapid ramp up of hiring. A similar solution is required for the migration to Oracle Cloud in Wave 1.

data.title: Automate assignment of placeholder SSN for employees who do not have one
data.description: For employees who are not hired in with an SSN like J1 visa holders a process should automate assignment of a placeholder SSN which is unique.

data.title: Job descriptions will not be edited when posting pipeline high volume
data.description: Current: Stores are able to edit the job descriptions as needed when opening requisitions Future: Job descriptions will be standardized and will not be edited. Because pipeline reqs are backfills, there isn t a need to choose a description, it should just flow within the process.

data.title: Only Professional Recruiters or TA Administrators will post requisitions
data.description: Current: Regional HR Division HR posts requisitions as needed Future: only professional recruiters or TA Administrators will post requisitions. pipeline evergreen reqs will all be created and posted by TA Administrator Note: Regional HR might have a difficult time relinquishing this since it s often easier to do it yourself HRBP might also be a professional recruiter depending on the division

data.title: Ability to view direct reports worklist
data.description: Current: Worklists i.e. HR approvals of things like promotions are sent to the entire Division HR Supply Chain HR teams to then work through together. Future: Worklist items will go to individual people, so Division HR leaders will no longer need to parse out items, and they still have visibility to see staff tasks to make sure they are making progress. Managers can take action to approve reject worklist items if they are not making progress.

data.title: Need a way to manage future dated LOA transactions from ClaimsVantage
data.description: ClaimsVantage currently has a real time API integration to update employee status when employees go on LOA. These updates can come through with future dated effective dates. We need a way to address the challenge of future dated transactions to minimize the negative impacts of future dated rows in other business processes. This came up during the LOA Processing deep dive. FYI accountid:5eebb63a1bf4530abd284a67 accountid:5f7f140ee0e85a006ea851bc accountid:5ef67a374d302e0ac3268b48 accountid:557058:d5e328c1 5c15 4967 abe6 75862c1498f2 Assigning to Guru for now and we will review as part of the FDD for this integration.

data.title: Security considerations for LOA processing
data.description: In Oracle Cloud, the roles that can change assignment status for LOA purposes should be limited in terms of what fields they can modify as part of their transactions. Additionally, only a select number of users should be able to modify the assignment status. For other team members, their access should be view only. FYI accountid:5f7f14096029960076f78ab4 accountid:5e1518019a4b780d990f0b0f accountid:5e56bb7f4befbd0c96ca1fc3 accountid:557058:d5e328c1 5c15 4967 abe6 75862c1498f2 accountid:5ef67a374d302e0ac3268b48

Once professional employees complete their Background check and results are complete and manual for exceptions. To check if employees when converted before the start date will they be able to access the additional tiles than onboarding and application tasks. Also do we need this for High Volume as well

data.title: Additional comp automatically flows from offer to compensation data
data.description: current state: if any kind of additional comp sign on bonus, relocation bonus, etc is added to a job offer, the details are added in RM but a recruiting coordinator actually has to enter that transaction after the associate i hired future: This will be automated

data.title: Report needed to capture employees that progress from a step with a higher rate to a step with a lower rate Exception Rated Report for Step Progression
data.description: Certain contracts have break in rates where the progression happens from one step with a higher rate to the next step with a lower rate. While Oracle has the capability to allow employees to progress to a lower salary, it cannot be restricted to certain contract step progression rules it will be applied to all step progression rules. Albertsons needs a report that identifies employees progressing from a higher rate to a lower rate who are not on a break in rate contract.

data.title: Trigger notification to employees to update tax forms when home or work location changes
data.description: Employees should be prompted to review and update their tax forms when they have a home or work location change.

data.title: Job Process to update mailstop
data.description: In PS, there is job that evaluates employees with changes to their job data that result in changes to their mail drop. accountid:5f7f140f459d420069b5073e is listed as being able to provide additional detail about this process.

data.title: Ability to enter placeholder SSN for employees who are awaiting an SSN to be issued
data.description: Some employees may begin working at Albertsons prior to receiving an SSN. Since SSN is required for payroll processing, we need a mechanism to provide a placeholder SSN for the employee until the final SSN is received.

data.title: Ability to track 401k eligibility date for all employees
data.description: PS has a custom field to capture the 401k eligibility date for all employees. This may be data that s fed in from Fidelity, but there was an open question for accountid:5f3eecc81ac29c0045e9f70b to confirm this.

data.title: Ability to lock certain seniority dates from being modified
data.description: In PS, the Trust Entry date has a checkbox that the trust team can use to lock the date so that it s not modified by any other processes or delivered functionality. This deviation is to track how we might achieve similar results in Oracle Cloud.

data.title: Need to capture earned, credited hours to use in wage progression rules
data.description: Wage progression uses various combinations of earned, credited hours. A solution to store this for use in wage progression will be needed in Wave 1.

data.title: Update employee salary rates when contracts are ratified
data.description: Union contracts can oftentimes be ratified long after they are actually effective. We need the ability to automate retroactive updates to employee salaries based on rate updates from the contract ratification.

data.title: Multiple address types in cloud
data.description: In current PeopleSoft system we are only capturing Home address for the employees. In the future state, it is decided to use multiple address types and provide employees the ability to identify preferred address for communications.

data.title: Ability to manually change ELIG CONFIG fields and prevent the automated process from making further changes
data.description: From the related requirement to automate maintenance of the ELIG CONFIG fields, we also need a way to remove an employee from that process if we want to manually override these fields for the employee.

data.title: Automate process to maintain ELIG CONFIG fields
data.description: PS has a process that automatically updates the ELIG CONFIG fields used in the feed to MSI for benefits eligibility based on changes to employee job data attributes. ABS needs a process in place in Oracle to continue this maintenance so that master job data is only changed in Oracle and passed to PS through the coexist model.

data.title: Converting Contingent Worker will not create a second LDAP
data.description: Current: When converting contingent workers, PS creates a new LDAP which creates confusion in the systems, often causing duplicate IDs Future: Converting a contingent worker in Oracle will not create a new LDAP because Oracle will treat it as the same person. If a contingent worker leaves and comes back, Oracle will recognize them as the same person.

data.title: Contingent Worker records will be in Oracle not excel
data.description: Current: Manually track contingent workers in excel, very manual process Future: Oracle will track contingent workers

data.title: To add Refuse to sign in the action tab in Onboarding
data.description: See if you can add in the actions tab refuse to sign and when they click that it should pop up new tab with some notes on it. And should be separate from Mark as Not applicable option. To show they refused to sign but the policy still applies to them.

data.title: Automate allocation of checklist tasks for policy confirmation based on selection criteria
data.description: Albertsons has some policies that require re confirmation on a periodic basis. We need a way based on the selection criteria defined below to automate the push of these tasks for the employee to complete eSignature of the policy. SELECTION CRITERIA : Last Hire Date, Division, Pay Group ABS or SWY , Union Non Union, Hourly Exempt, Job Code Pharmacist and age.

data.description: ADP i9 is not an Oracle enabled vendor for i 9. Only Hireright is the Oracle enabled vendor for this process.

data.description: The following additional person types will be configured for Albertsons: System Person Type User Person Type Albertsons Additional Person Types Employee Employee Temporary Company Employee J1 Contingent Worker Contingent Worker Independent Contractor Temporary Agency Employee Vendor Employee Non Employee Non Employee PG 040

data.title: Service Catalog Milestones SLA Deep Dive
data.description: There are 4 priorities, Urgent 1 Day, High 5 days, Medium 10 days, Low 20 days. For milestones, we want only the waiting milestone with a 5 day allowance and then state change being forced back to In Progress .

data.title: Automatically convert Pending Workers to Employees after specific conditions have been met
data.description: Once employees pass a background check, they should be automatically converted from pending worker to employee. accountid:5f7f1244b61f66006f4e78c1 accountid:5f3e7d40e1154200468e952e Please add any other details about the criteria we would want to apply in selecting the employee population we want to autoconvert from pending worker to employee.

data.title: Required name fields and additional name attributes
data.description: First and last name should be required for all employees. We should also allow employees to provide a preferred first name and also track a previous last name.

data.title: Supervisor hierarchy
data.description: Current supervisor hierarchy in PS is set up to roll downward when someone is terminated whereas in Cloud if someone is terminated the manager reassigns to a different manager or if position hierarchy is in place, those employees roll up to the leader in the next position. The user either Manager of Store Director or HR representative who is transferring or terminating the Store Director can handle reassigning all of their direct reports to the appropriate person. As a back up, we can create an HCM Extract of type Inbound Interface to identify employees meeting the specific criteria assigned to a manager outside their store or a terminated manager and reassign to an employee in the store in the SD job, if that doesn t exist, reassign to the ASD, if that doesn t exist we would roll up to the DM.

data.description: When an employee moves around Albertsons and between companies the organization would like a standardized onboarding checklist to be delivered to improve the employee and HR user experience.

data.title: Centralized TA will eventually support all functional groups
data.description: Current: Centralized TA only supports Campus Future: Centralized TA will eventually support all functional groups corporate, division office, retail, supply dc including marketing, branding, experience, hiring events a 2 3 year journey Don t have a defined future state yet. Currently capturing things we know today which would impact where a centralized function would come into play.

data.title: HRBP will approve requisitions after Hiring Manager initiates in Oracle
data.description: Current: HRBP s are in the weeds of the recruiting process, often creating reqs Future: Hiring Manager will create requisition, HRBP will approve, TA will post

data.title: 3 Candidate Selection Processes 3 CSP
data.description: Current: there are many different processes as there is not a standardized recruiting process. Future: There will be 3 standardized candidate selection processes CSP : 2 standard 1 professional, 1 executive 1 high volume

data.title: Report list will be standardized and reduced from current
data.description: Current: there are 813 HR Help Desk reports a lot are duplicate records, duplicate with small customizations, old reports never removed, one use case but aren t used to run the business, etc. Future: List will be reduced to the mandatory and most useful reports needed to run the business.

data.title: Changing settings in Oracle for Performance Review will be locked once performance document is kicked off
data.description: Current: N A not done in a formal system Future: Once processes are defined and performance document is kicked off, you cannot make changes. If you have a performance document for a handful employees, changing settings is locked. Once you close out of a performance doc, you can make changes. So what: HR Analyst will need to coordinate timing of any changes to settings for performance review in Oracle.

data.title: Managers will comment and rate overall competencies, overall goals, and overall summary for performance reviews
data.description: Current: Managers comment and rate every single goal. Future: Managers will comment and rate overall competencies, overall goals, and overall summary rather than by each goal. So what: Managers will need to provide a summary comment and rating for evaluations of their direct reports, which will be less granular than by goal.

data.title: Standard and Critical Alerts will be sent to Associate for approaching performance evaluation deadlines
data.description: Current: HR reaches out to remind employees of approaching performance evaluation deadlines. Future: Automatic notifications through email and in the system will be sent to employees as reminders of deadlines. Associates will also be receiving communications from HRBPs. So what: For some emails, I will not be receiving reminders from HR a person s name that I may recognize . I need to be cognizant of auto generated emails that I may be receiving from the system.

data.title: Standard and Critical Alerts will be sent through Oracle
data.description: Current: HR reaches out to employees for approaching deadlines on performance reviews Future: Oracle has standard and critical alerts that can be sent out through email and through a notification in the system. So what: HR will not need to reach out to employees manually to remind them to complete their evaluations

data.title: Associates will comment on overall competencies, overall goals, and overall summary for performance reviews
data.description: Current: Associates comment on every single goal. Future: Associates will comment on overall competencies, overall goals, and overall summary rather than by each goal. So what: Associates will need to provide a summary for their self evaluation, which will be less granular than by goal.

data.title: Competencies will be part of the Performance Review
data.description: Current: Competencies are not specifically a focus for performance reviews. Future: Competencies will be part of the performance review, in addition to goals. So what: Associates and People Managers will need to comment on performance on competencies.

data.title: SR 3 25661490491: Certain fields in Cloud don t trigger event for atom feeds when changed Fix Expected in July Fix for 21B

Certain fields in Cloud doesn t trigger event for atom feeds when changed: Regular Temporary Full Part Time FTE Bargaining Unit Collective Agreement Non Primary mailing addresses Non Primary National Identifiers Phone types other than: Work phone W1 , Work mobile WM , Home phone H1 , Home fax HF Email types other than Work Email W1 Date of Death Country of Birth Emergency Contact, Phone, Phone Type Manager types other than Line Manager

data.title: Goal Setting Module is separate from Performance Management Module
data.description: Current: Goal setting is part of the performance management process Future: Goal module is separate from Performance Management module. Goals will flow into the performance management cycle however, if you add goals in performance management, it will not flow back to the Goals module. So what: Employees should input and update their goals in the goal module in Oracle

data.title: There will be mid year and year end reviews
data.description: Current: Some divisions groups do performance reviews twice a year, whereas some do not. Future: There will be mid year and year end reviews. Mid year reviews will be more developmental focused, and will not include ratings. Year end reviews will have ratings and will be connected to compensation. So what: Those involved in the review process will need to participate in reviews twice a year and adopt the process. Most of the divisions will go down to Store Director Level but manually

data.title: Transfer means to change job within a location, Change Location means to change stores
data.description: Current: Transfer means Change Location and Job Reclass means job change within a store Future: Transfer job change within store, Change Location change store

data.title: Managers will no longer be able to initiate demotion via MSS
data.description: Current: Managers can initiate demotion via MSS in PeopleSoft and then it routes to HR Future: Managers will need to reach out to HR if they wish to demote their direct report

data.title: Only HR will have access to initiate a demotion in Oracle
data.description: Current: Managers have the ability in PeopleSoft to initiate a demotion, but the workflow routes to HR who then has a long conversation about it with the manager Future: Only HR will have this access in Oracle, so managers need to reach out to HR if they want to demote someone

data.title: Ability to move more than one associate at a time when moving direct reports
data.description: When moving direct reports, there is the ability to move many at once, saving time instead of moving each person individually. Current: PS only allows MSS moving one at a time. Future: More visibility

data.title: HR will be notified for changes in salary for Corporate Backstage roles
data.description: In the future, Corporate backstage roles changes in salary will notify HR, but retail and SCM changes in salary will not. There is a threshold for retail and SCM to go to HR as per original design . All changes in corporate and backstage, a notification goes to HR. If the salary change is more than 10 or whatever is defined , in both workflows, it will be routed to HR for approval

data.title: HR will approve changes in salary initiated by Managers only if above the threshold
data.description: Current: In some divisions, HR approves all changes in salary that managers initiate in People Soft. Future: HR will not approve changes in salary initiated by managers but will look at reports and audit periodically. If it is above the threshold, HR will have to approve.

data.title: Manager will initiate salary changes with no HR approvals
data.description: Current: people managers initiate change in salary now, but some divisions have an HR approval in place and some do not, but they ve all talked to the employee before putting it into the system Future: There will be no approvals for salary changes, but managers will receive a warning if they try to give a pay raise outside the parameters In the future, Corporate backstage roles changes in salary will notify HR, but retail and SCM changes in salary will not. There is a threshold for retail and SCM to go to HR as per original design . All changes in corporate and backstage, a notification goes to HR. If the salary change is more than 10 or whatever is defined , in both workflows, it will be routed to HR for approval

data.title: Legal name changes will require associates to upload required documents before HR approves
data.description: Current : legal name changes go through an approval to Manager then to HR, no approval for preferred. PS will send notification to manager HR. Manager needs to see SSC and then send an email they ve seen the card. Future : legal name changes will require approval but preferred name changes will not. Associates will upload documentation to Oracle and the workflow will route to HR for approval. HR will approve with no manager involvement. Associates will upload documents for legal name change through ESS Since Oracle does not provide the ability to make attachments required on the name change this should be a training item to instruct employees when submitting a name change to submit an attachment for proof of the name change. When the name change goes for approval, the approver can request additional information from the employee and send the transaction back to them if they forgot to upload the proper documentation.

data.title: Lower level managers must submit their merit worksheets upward for approval before a higher level manager can approve them.
data.description: Current State: N A Future State: Manager Must First Submit Lower level managers must submit their worksheets upward for approval before a higher level manager can approve them. Ensures that higher managers don t approve worksheets before lower managers have had time to complete them. All Managers Must Be Approved Lower level managers must have their worksheets approved before a higher level manager can submit his own worksheet for approval. Ensures that higher managers review and approve allocations of lower managers before submitting allocations for their entire organization for approval. So what: Managers must approve the worksheets of those below them before submitting.

data.title: Compensation Plan in Oracle to Handle Equity so Compensation Analyst will need to manually upload yearly and monthly grants from Oracle to Fidelity
data.description: Current: Equity Administration is in Fidelity Future: Compensation Plan will be set up in Oracle to allocate RSUs and have information accessible in ESS So what: I will need to do a manual upload for the yearly and monthly grants from Oracle to Fidelity

data.title: Remove ability for learners to withdraw from course

data.title: Create a Workforce Compensation Plan for Annual Merit Increase US and Canada
data.description: A single merit based plan will be created in Oracle Cloud with the following components: Eligibility rules to pull all eligible employees into the plan https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1582 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1582 smart link . If the employee is on an active PIP, they become ineligible for a merit increase Approval Hierarchy to route the worksheets for approval https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1322 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1322 smart link Worksheet layout to display employee information that is relevant to the plan https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1587 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1587 smart link Merit Increase factors and rules https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1751 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1751 smart link Proration rules https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1585 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1585 smart link Lump Sum calculation rules https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1626 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1626 smart link Worker level Budgeting https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1321 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1321 smart link A single compensation change statement for Merits https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1752 https: albertsons1.atlassian.net browse HCM 1752 smart link Every manager s worksheet should only display all eligible employees. Employees that are on a leave of absence will be eligible but should not get their merit increase until they return from leave. The Merit Increase effective date is different based on the Pay Group the employee falls under this date needs to be captured in the merit worksheets and used as part of the Compensation to HR Transfer process.

data.title: Personal data change verification of SSN for Legal Name Change DOB Change

This is more of an in person process. Future: HR Site Support will initiate a SSN change directly in the Associate s personal data. The initiated request would route to the HRIS Specialist with no documentation attached, assuming validation happened onsite. So What: Makes this process more automated solves problem of store manager not doing approvals

data.title: Initiating Job Changes via MSS Removes step for AEC
data.description: Current: In Corporate, Manager initiates job changes, goes to AEC, then HR, and then generates a letter. HR updates in the backend. Everything is done through email. In Retail, manager submits the job change through Manager Self Service. This may vary by division at Jewel Osco, the hourly store EE job comp change requests are submitted by the store s Personnel Coordinator and are routed to Division HR Specialist s worklist for approval or denial. Salaried EE job comp changes are submitted by Division HR Specialist. Future: Manager will still consult with HR but will do the update in the system So what: Manager will have the extra step in the system

data.title: Submitting Resignation via ESS instead of turning paper into Manager
data.description: Current: Employees in stores, division offices, and DCs submit resignation in person and in writing signed and with date Future: Employees will submit resignation in Oracle self service So what: Better data tracking, more convenient process since employees don t need to show up in person

data.title: Exit Survey Timing Standardized across divisions for associates
data.description: Current: Divisions are doing it differently or not at all, timing is different Future: want to make this process consistent through Oracle still need to discuss timing after leaving the company, putting in resignation, etc. . This is limited to voluntary resignations TBD on timing So what: Data standardization and streamlined offboarding process

We want to drive towards managers being able to initiate through self service So what: Extra step for managers

Union and bargaining information is in Oracle, but it will tied to the position level for grades, rate, etc. It will be captured and represented differently from how it is in PeopleSoft. So what: Need to learn how to access and manage information in Oracle.

data.description: Current State: Performing processes such as promotions terminations are manual Future State: Managers will be able to perform processes through the chatbot through links, such as promotions, terminations, etc. So what: Saves time for managers performing these processes, since they are empowered to do it through the chatbot rather than calling someone

data.title: Self service and reporting capabilities will allow for more reporting analytics
data.description: Current State: Competing priorities and lack of information result in a lack of reporting analytics Future State: Introduction of SS and Reporting will allow for more reporting analytics for AEC Associates So what: Ability to have more reporting analytics to measure performance and assess needs

data.title: Next Generation Search Engine will result in a different search experience for Associates since the catalog will no longer be customized by division
data.description: Current State: Search is not optimized for users. The learner catalog is customized by division and only contains the course the division wants the learner to see. There are 14 separate learning systems currently. Future State: Participating in the Early Adopter Program for Next Generation Search Engine will result in faster response times, quality search results, ability to find learning catalogs easier. There will only be one catalog which will contain the set of OBW courses for all divisions, not unique to one division. Huge change for divisions in how they look at that catalog. Needs to be looked at as resources you may be assigned but other items are optional learning you may take. From a company standpoint, not division. So what: Improved search experience for associates using the LMS

data.title: Learning Analyst can assign audiences through rule sets

data.title: Learning Analyst will have ability to find and replace courses throughout the entire system
data.description: Current State: Finding and replacing courses is a manual process Future State: Learning Analyst will have the ability to find and replace courses throughout the entire system where it exists So what: Saving time by replacing courses throughout each area where it exists

data.title: Learning Analyst will have the ability to find and replace retired courses

data.title: Learning Analyst will have the ability to clone a course, activity, or offering

data.description: Current State: N A Future State: Managers will assign direct reports to Learning Journeys for specializations through MSS. Learning Journeys will be part of the catalog. data.title: Ability to pull regulatory reporting automatically and send to email
data.description: Current State: Pulling reports is a manual process Future State: Scheduled reporting will allow the Learning Analyst to pull reporting automatically and have it sent in an email So what: Streamlined process to pull reporting automatically will save time

data.title: Learning reporting security to be granted to other roles other than learning analyst for reporting self service
data.description: Current State: Pulling reports can be a time suck if people do not have the right access Future State: Certain roles i.e. HR Manager will be granted learning data security privileges so that they can run learning reports to the department division that apply to them. There will be greater access for users to run reports. Reporting permissions are linked to roles, i.e. the role a user has assigned will determine which reports can be accessed. Therefore anyone with the appropriate role will be able to run the reports associated with that role. So what: New process will save time in accessing reports. All reports will be in OTBI. Reports will be tied based to your role with your area of responsibility which will drive results.

data.title: Learning Analyst will have the ability to pull report and have it saved into a folder through interfacing
data.description: Current State: Reports are pulled through a query, which can slow the system down Future State: Learning Analyst will have the ability to pull reports and have it saved directly into a folder through interfacing rather than running a query So what: Streamlined process, process will not slow down the entire system

data.description: Eliminate the step that the applicant has to accept the offer letter online. The recruiter has the option to accept it on behalf of the applicant So what: Better engagement to the applicant.

data.title: Worksheet Layout for the Merit Increase Process

data.title: Alerts and Proration Rules for the Merit Increase Process
data.description: A standard set of proration rules will be configured for the Merit Increase process Assuming Fiscal year 2020 cycle 3 1 2020 to 2 28 2021 Hire Date Pro ration Factor Q2 2021 6 21 2021 9 12 2021 100 of merit increase Q3 2021 9 13 2021 12 5 2021 75 of merit increase Q4 2021 12 6 2021 02 27 2022 50 of merit increase Q1 2022 3 1 2022 6 20 2022 0 of merit increase If a proration occurs, the recommended merit increase range will have to get prorated as well. The Merit budgets will also need to get reduced based on the proration percentage. The following alerts will need to be configured as well: Alerts updated on 5 17 21 Alert Name Alert Type: Informational Alert Description Increase Below Guideline Confirm that the merit increase is intended to be below guideline. Increase Below 1 Confirm that the merit increase is intended to be below 1 of new salary rate. Increase Above Guideline Confirm that the merit increase is intended to be above the recommended guideline No increase provided No increase has been provided Note: as discussed previously, other alerts will not display if no increase has been provided No Performance Rating Confirm that no performance rating as been provided for the employee

data.title: Eligibility Criteria for the Annual Merit Increase Process US and Canada
data.description: 1 All corporate, supply chain, division office and retail non union employees that are not on a step progression plan are deemed eligible 2 The cut off date for eligibility is end of the FY 3 Employee must be Active Payroll Eligible or Leave of Absence Payroll Eligible in order to be eligible for a merit increase. If on leave of absence, merit is delayed until return employees do not get increases until or if they return Identifying Shaw s non union merit eligible employees: Should belong to Shaw s Business Unit and the Yearly GWI Date should be blank.

data.title: Add Course Effective Date Functionality
data.description: Currently OLC has a course start and end date. The course start date makes the course active and the course end date make the course in active. In our business we release new courses that are target for new learners. Typically due to payroll constraints we do not make an existing associate complete the new course. This process forces us to create a new course audience instead of using the existing position audience. For example a new course on produce freshness would not be assigned to the 10,000 existing produce associates but would be assigned to new learners. To implement this request we would need to create new audience for the Produce freshness assigned to all produce clerks with a start date after 11.13.20 Impact Without this feature will cause excessive use of payroll and assignment training that is not necessary. Or, will increase the number of audiences by 2 to 3x. Solution A course effective date would override the position audience date if used and would only assign it to new learners after the effective date. accountid:5c585ca195f91f3a04204623 accountid:5a67a91e2eed6b2d0236e0d5 accountid:5a67a9189089ba71829fce28 accountid:5a67a91a4e6fa32306362384 accountid:5f7f140ae31b69006fdf014e

data.title: Leverage market survey data in the system for Bench marking capabilities
data.description: Based off Compensation Day 2 validation workshops, the Albertsons team would like to be able to update the survey data in the system rather than have to upload new data every couple of months. On 1 21, the market survey data capabilities in Oracle were demoed. Market Survey data can be loaded in Oracle and used as a Storage tool. The loaded Market Survey data after being tied to benchmarked jobs can then be brought into and displayed in the comp worksheets so that managers can reference that information to make compensation decisions at the time of merit allocations. The delivered functionality isn t designed to function as a true benchmarking tool.

They will likely still receive support from Compensation Team So what: Process is more streamlined

data.title: MSS for allocating bonus awards in the future for certain managers instead of all being calculated by the compensation team
data.description: Current State: Compensation team calculates bonus awards for all employees Future State: Certain managers will have access to MSS to allocate adjust bonus awards based on performance So what: Lessens the workload for Compensation Team

data.title: Eligibility rules will be built into Oracle so that only eligible employees will show up on the worksheets so there isn t a need to manually scrub
data.description: Current State: Data is manually scrubbed to ensure that only eligible employees are included Future State: Eligibility rules in Oracle will ensure that only eligible employees are included in the data for bonuses. For Merit, we will also display ineligible employees and the reason why they are ineligible. So what: Streamlined process, eliminates a step for the compensation analyst to scrub data

data.title: Nothing is visible to the employee in the merit process until it is effective, so there will be less to coordinate with communications, loading, etc.
data.description: Current State: Loading merit increases once compensation is determined involves a lot of coordination on the back end Future State: Merit information is displayed to the employee automatically when deemed effective So what: Streamlined process, Associates will automatically be shown my merit information when it is deemed effective.

data.title: The employee salary will be updated as part of the merit increase process and will no longer have to be manually loaded
data.description: Current State: Employee salary updates are manually loaded Future State: Employee salary will be updated as part of the merit increase process and won t be manually loaded So what: Streamlined process and one less step for the AEC

data.title: Statements will be combined to include merit, bonus, and equity if eligible in Spring 2023
data.description: Current State: Merit, bonus, and equity are communicated separately Future State: Compensation Change Statement will include merit, bonus, equity this will not be in effect for Spring 2022. So what: Reduction in number of statements, with important information consolidated into one statement This is still TBD, as there hasn t been any final decision made. This will not be in Wave 1.

data.title: Statements will only include change in compensation statement instead of total compensation statement
data.description: Current State: There is no total compensation statement today. Future State: Employees will only receive a change in compensation statement So what: Less redundant statements sent to employee, as information is in Fidelity Closed because this is not a change impact. We are just automating the same process.

data.title: Bonus process will occur after the annual performance review
data.description: Current State: Bonus process does not occur with performance review cycle TBD on how each division conducts their bonus cycle today Future State: Bonus process is aligned to the performance review cycle and will occur after the annual performance review So what: Performance reviews can affect bonus decisions

data.title: Bonus plans will be consolidated and calculated in Oracle instead of a spreadsheet
data.description: Current State: Bonus plans are calculated through Excel spreadsheets Future State: Bonus plans will be calculated in Oracle So what: Ability to streamline processes and store data in system

data.title: Ability to view employee s historical performance review ratings
data.description: Current: need to contact AEC, manager, or someone else to see historical records if there are any Future: HRBPs Managers can view their employee s historical ratings in Oracle So What: streamlined process

data.title: There will be one system for reviewing talent Oracle
data.description: Current: different systems and or lack of systems for different elements of reviewing talent. Divisions currently use Excel more manual processes. Future: Ability to move from talent review meeting to succession planning and talent pools and diagnose learning needs in one system So What: better data integrity

data.title: Existence of Talent Management process is new for certain divisions
data.description: Current: Some divisions do not have talent performance management Future: All divisions will have a standardized talent performance management process So What: streamlined processes and better talent management across the business

data.title: ESS to update talent profile
data.description: Current: Unable to update talent profile via self service Future: Associates will be able to update their talent profile through self service in Oracle So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: Talent Admin will have ability to create talent pools
data.description: Current: No talent pools Future: Talent Admin is able to create talent pools in Oracle So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: Existence of talent pools will help identify candidates for succession planning
data.description: Current: No talent pools Future: Existence of talent pools will help identify people for succession planning proactively for the HRBPs. Candidates must be added manually. So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: HRBPs can have strategic conversations on succession planning with less manual work and better data
data.description: Current: HRBPs have a lot of manual work for succession planning and data cleanup Future: HRBPs will have the manual aspect of succession planning automated or removed so they can focus on looking at accurate data and having strategic succession plan conversations with the business So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: MSS ability to add direct reports to a succession plan
data.description: Current: No MSS succession plan capabilities Future: Managers will be able to add direct reports to succession plans in Oracle So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: MSS ability to see their people if they have succession plans or if they re on succession plans
data.description: Current: Unable to tell if your employee is on or has succession plan easily Future: Managers will be able to see their people if they have succession plans and if they re on succession plans in Oracle So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: Ability to pull any employee from the enterprise onto succession plan via MSS
data.description: Current: Only able to succession plan in division Future: Managers will have the ability to pull any employee from the enterprise onto any succession plan they have access to So What: Better and more robust succession planning

data.title: Final Pay solution in Cloud
data.description: Final Pay Several states have final pay statute requirements for terminated employees and some employers are required to issue an employee s last paycheck by the next regular payday. Currently termination is initiated in MSS HRSS, and EE T A hours comes from WB to Final Pay page for processing. Discuss how this will flow in future state.

data.title: MSS to add candidates to succession plans
data.description: Current: HRBPs and Talent team identifies succession planning Future: Managers will be able to add candidates to succession plans in Oracle So what: Ability for managers to be more involved in succession planning

data.description: Current: No real technology so terminology is known Future: Terminology used in Oracle is different from current So What: Need to understand terminology
