data.title: Determine notifications for performance and talent processes
data.description: Decided this deviation during the Talent Succession validation session. Succession Plans to plan owners : Send alerts when candidates move to the plan role Send alerts when candidates move to roles that are different from the plan role Send alerts when the incumbent changes roles Decision default off Talent Profile to user : Content added to talent profile Content deleted from talent profile Content updated on talent profile Decision default off Talent Review to review participants : Talent Review is scheduled prepare review content image 20210205 030034.png width 1652,height 311 Decision default on, new ticket to confirm messaging Goal Notifications: Notification Effect of Enabling HR assigns a goal The employees assigned the goal get a notification when their HR specialist mass assigns performance goals. HR cancels a goal The employees assigned the goal get a notification when their HR specialist cancels the goal. HR deletes a goal The employees assigned the goal get a notification when their HR specialist deletes the goal. HR generates goal plan The employees assigned the goals in the goal plan and their managers get a notification when the HR specialist assigns a goal plan. HR updates a goal The employees assigned the goal get a notification when their HR specialist updates a goal. Manager assigns a goal The employees get a notification when their manager assigns a goal to them. Manager cancels a goal The employees get a notification when their manager cancels any goal. Manager cancels an assigned goal The employees assigned the goal and their HR specialists get a notification when a manager cancels a goal that was assigned by the HR specialist. Manager creates a goal The employees get a notification when their manager creates a goal. Manager deletes a goal assigned by HR The employees get a notification when their manager deletes a goal that was assigned to them by their HR specialist. Manager deletes an assigned goal The HR specialist gets a notification when a manager deletes a goal that was assigned by the HR specialist. Manager updates a goal The employees get a notification when their manager updates a goal. Organization assigns a goal The employees get a notification when an organization owner assigns a goal to them. Organization owner cancels a goal The employees get a notification when an organization owner cancels a goal. Organization owner publishes a goal The employees get a notification when an organization owner enables a goal for sharing with the organization. Worker cancels a goal assigned by HR The HR specialist gets a notification when an employee cancels a goal assigned by the HR specialist. Worker deletes a goal assigned by HR The HR specialist gets a notification when an employee deletes a goal assigned by the HR specialist. Performance Management Notifications: Notification Description Enabled Critical Alert Due Date has been reached for a task Manager, worker, or both receive notification when the Critical Alert Due Date was reached for a task as defined in the performance template. Yes HR cancels worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist cancels worker s performance document. No HR completes worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist completes worker s performance document. No HR creates worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist has created the worker s performance document. No HR deletes worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist deletes worker s performance document. No HR moves current performance task in process back Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist resets an earlier task in the process flow and that task is ready to action. Yes HR moves current performance task in process forward Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist bypasses the current task. Yes HR re opens worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist reopens worker s performance document. No HR restores worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist restores worker s performance document. No HR reviews worker s performance document Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist indicates they have reviewed the worker s performance document. No HR transfers control of the task to set goals to manager Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist transfers control of the task to set goals from worker to manager. No HR transfers control of the task to set goals to worker Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist transfers control of the task to set goals from manager to worker. Yes HR transfers worker s performance document to new manager Former and new manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist transfers worker s performance document to new manager. No HR verifies review meeting Manager and worker receive notification when human resources specialist verifies that review meeting was held. No Manager bypasses uncompleted worker self evaluation task Worker receives notification when manager has bypassed the uncompleted worker self evaluation task. Yes Manager cancels worker s performance document Worker receives notification when manager cancels worker s performance document. Yes Manager completes worker s evaluation Worker receives notification when manager has completed evaluation of worker. No Manager completes worker s performance document Worker receives notification when manager completes worker s performance document. No Manager creates worker s performance document Worker receives notification when manager has created worker s performance document. No Manager deletes worker s performance document Worker receives notification when manager deletes worker s performance document. Yes Manager enters worker s evaluation criteria Worker receives notification when manager has entered worker s performance document evaluation criteria. Yes Manager indicates review meeting held Worker receives notification when manager indicates the review meeting was held. The next step in the process flow requires that worker verifies the meeting was held. No Manager provides final feedback Worker receives notification when manager provides final feedback. Yes Manager re opens worker s performance document Worker receives notification when manager reopens worker s performance document. Yes Manager resets worker s self evaluation Worker receives notification when manager resets the status of worker s self evaluation. No Manager restores worker s performance document Worker receives notification when manager restores worker s performance document. Yes Manager shares performance document with worker and retains control of it Worker receives notification when manager shares worker s performance document. Control of the document remains with manager. Yes Manager shares performance document with worker and transfers control to worker Worker receives notification when manager shares worker s performance document. Control of the document is transferred to worker. Yes Manager transfers worker s performance document to another manager New manager and worker receive notification when manager transfers worker s performance document to another manager. No Manager shares set goals task Worker receives notification when worker shares the set goals task Yes Participant Feedback HR changes participant s feedback due date Feedback participant receives notification when HR changes the participant s feedback due date. No Participant Feedback HR deletes participant Feedback participant and performance document manager receive notification when HR deletes the participant after the request was sent. If the worker selected the participant, the worker will also receive a notification. Yes Participant Feedback Manager changes participant s feedback due date Feedback participant receives notification when performance document manager changes the participant s feedback due date. Yes Participant Feedback Manager deletes participant Feedback participant receives notification when the performance document manager deletes the participant after the request was sent. If the worker selected the participant, the worker also receives a notification. No Participant Feedback Manager sends feedback request to participant Feedback participant receives a request to provide feedback from the worker s performance document manager. Yes Participant Feedback Notify worker a participant the worker selected was sent a feedback request Worker receives notification when the performance document manager sends a request to a participant the worker selected. No Participant Feedback Participant feedback due date reminder Feedback participant receives notification when the Standard Alert Due Date is reached for feedback task as defined in the performance template or as otherwise indicated during the participant request process. No Participant Feedback Participant locked out Feedback participant receives notification when the performance document manager indicates that feedback can no longer be received. Yes Participant Feedback Participant role change Feedback participant receives another feedback request when their role is changed. Yes Participant Feedback Participant submits feedback to manager Manager who sent request to the participant receives notification when the participant submits the completed feedback. Yes Participant Feedback Participant submits feedback to worker Worker who sent request to the participant receives notification when the participant submits the completed feedback. No Participant Feedback Worker completes self evaluation Notify participants selected to be evaluation viewers in the Manage Performance Roles task. Yes Participant Feedback Worker deletes participant Feedback participant and performance document manager receive notification when the worker deletes the participant after the request was sent. Yes Participant Feedback Worker sends feedback request to participant Feedback participant receives a request to provide feedback from the worker. No Participant Feedback Worker submits participant list to manager Performance document manager receives notification from the worker that the worker completed the task of selecting feedback participants. Yes Performance document due date has been changed Manager, worker, or both receive notification when a due date was changed for a performance document task. Yes Standard Alert Due Date has been reached for a task Manager, worker, or both receive notification when the Standard Alert Due Date was reached for a task as defined in the performance template. Yes Worker completes self evaluation Manager receives notification when worker has completed self evaluation. Yes Worker creates their performance document Manager receives notification when worker has created a performance document. Yes Worker enters their evaluation criteria Manager receives notification when worker has entered performance document evaluation criteria. Yes Worker provides final feedback Manager receives notification when worker provides final feedback. No Worker reviews their performance document Manager receives notification when worker indicates that review of performance document is complete. No Worker verifies review meeting Manager receives notification when worker verifies that review meeting was held. No Worker shares set goals task Manager receivers notification when worker shares the set goals task No

data.title: Learning Analyst will have the ability to Diagnose Learning Needs
data.description: Current: Don t have system data to assess learning needs Future state: Start tracking system data to build reports. I can also add learning requests through Help Desk and perform analysis on inquiries. So what: Can better understand learning needs of employees

data.title: External Certifications will be tracked in Oracle
data.description: Current: External certifications are not tracked in a system Future: Ability for employee to use self service and input external certifications so they can be tracked in the system. The user will add it to their learning profile. So what: Streamlined tracking for certifications

data.title: External Training Approvals will be tracked through Oracle
data.description: Current: Approvals are tracked manually Future: Learning team will track through Oracle LMS So what: Increase efficiency

data.title: External Training Approvals will happen via MSS
data.description: Current: Manager does not do approvals through MSS. Forms are mailed, faxed, and emailed in. Future: Manager will be able to approve through one system So what: Increased efficiency in the process

data.title: Associate will have ability to submit a request and register for External Learning
data.description: Current: Don t utilize technology for external learning Future: Will be able to use Oracle to manage this workflow by submitting a request for external learning and registering if approved. This is assuming the learning library Skillsoft will be available. So what: Will make the process more efficient and easily trackable

data.title: Evaluation Data will be available for Learning Analyst to make adjustments to courses
data.description: Current: Not tracking evaluation data Future: Tracking evaluation data. Not going to use on every course, just ILT, etc. Instead of using paper and pencil evaluations, we ll automate so we can get the responses categorized without having to do it manually. So what: Tracking evaluation data will provide the Learning Team to make adjustments to courses to increase effectiveness

data.title: Evaluations will be prompted for some courses likely Pharmacy
data.description: Current: Not common to do evaluations on learnings Future: Some courses will have mandatory evaluations Pharmacy , and multiple templates will be used. Some courses require evaluation because of continuing education. So what: Extra step for the learner learner has ability to provide feedback This will evolve as we move forward.

data.title: Better data integrity for learning to provide better analytics
data.description: Current: Future: Better data in the system will provide better analytics and save time. All learning will be in the system i.e. JJ Keller, Alchemy, skill soft, and Pharmacist Letter So what: Ability for more in depth analysis

data.title: OLC is in an integrated system, and the interface Landing Page, Learning Page, Filters, etc. will be different and will require a simple training for Retail associates
data.description: Current: Future: OLC interface is significantly different from the current LMS. The Landing page contains all HR activities in an integrated system, and Learning is accessed through a learning icon not automatically when logged into the application . Define Current Learning, What to learn and my learning communities. Review entire learning page. Navigation of each page and use of filters. There will need to be two versions of training: one simple skill training for Retail and one detail for Corporate professional development So what: Retail associates will need to receive a simple training for OLC Division associates will have more search abilities. Bringing in courses from an outside vendor and need to categorize appropriately DC .

data.title: Different process for assigning audiences in Oracle
data.description: Current: Future: Assigning audiences is different than current LMS So what: Need training to adjust to the change

data.title: There will be one best way to Contact Learning Team through Helpdesk
data.description: Current: Questions are routed through emails and tickets on ServiceNow Future: One Best way for store ops managers to contact the learning team instead of various emails, calls, tickets, etc. So what: Streamlined process and ease of tracking

data.title: There will be one best way to Contact Learning Team through HR Helpdesk
data.description: Current: Questions are routed through emails and tickets on ServiceNow Future: One Best way for store ops managers to contact the learning team instead of various emails, calls, tickets, etc. So what: Streamlined process and ease of tracking

data.title: Standardized merit cycle dates across all divisions, groups, etc. to drive towards one best way
data.description: Current: Different divisions groups have different merit cycle dates Future: Standardized merit cycle dates across all divisions, groups, etc. to drive towards one best way So what: More standardization in merit cycles

data.title: There will be a different budget for promotion compensation increases vs. merit increases
data.description: Current: Promotion compensation and merit increases are part of the same budget Future: There will be a different budget for promotion compensation increases vs. merit increases So what: Less complexity in determining amounts for promotion increases vs. merit increases

data.title: Historical Compensation Statements will be in Oracle
data.description: Current: Employee reaches out to HR, and HR works with Compensation to retrieve past compensation change statements Future: Employee can see historical statements in self service. This will have a Phase 2 impact. So what: Streamlining process and cutting out steps, also provides on demand information

data.title: Compensation Change Statements via ESS in Oracle
data.description: Current: Compensation change statements are printed out for discussion with employee Future: Employees can check their compensation statements in Employee self service So what: Less paper, more self service

data.title: Compensation Analyst will review merit worksheets for accuracy
data.description: Current: Data cleaning exercise occurs before anything is processed Future: Data needs to be cleaned real time and reflect any changes, which will primarily be handled by managers. Compensation Analyst will need to review merit worksheets for accuracy, ensuring there aren t system errors. So what: Increase efficiency and accuracy of data

data.title: No more holdbacks on the merit budget
data.description: Current: Holdback on a percentage of the merit budget Future: Holdbacks are no longer allowed, rely on the process to update and manage the budget appropriately So what: Reduce complexity and increase flexibility in budgeting

data.title: Leadership Review of compensation information in Oracle
data.description: Current: Leadership team receives compensation reports to review out of the system Future: Leadership will view compensation reports in Oracle and will provide approvals in the system So what: Less paper, more data tracking abilities. Perception is dependent by leader someone supporting can also print out reports from Oracle.

data.title: Managers will be responsible for keeping associate information up to date in MSS
data.description: Current: HRBPs are managing impacted associates, with an additional integrity audit outside of PeopleSoft Future: Managers will be responsible for keeping associate information up to date. They can delegate a proxy. This will be a mental shift to have the responsibility of keeping my team s data up to date. So what: Managers will take on more responsibility for their associates

data.title: Managers will manage Impacted Associates which will remove a task from HRBP
data.description: Current: HRBPs are managing impacted associates, with an additional integrity audit outside of PeopleSoft Future: Managers will be responsible for keeping associate information up to date. They can delegate a proxy. HRBPs will need to stay involved in case there are ER LR implications for union associates. So what: Managers will take on more responsibility for their associates

data.title: Managers will need to abide by the cycle dates in the system
data.description: Current: There are dates in place, but don t abide by then. Bonuses that are paid out sometimes get fixed afterwards. Future: Managers will need to abide by the dates in the system and are held responsible to completing their tasks So what: More efficiencies and accuracy in the system, with less re work. Need to hold managers responsible

data.title: Rehire eligibility flag education
data.description: Current: Rehire eligibility is tied to term code reason Future: Rehire eligibility flag is manually selected by managers and approved by HR So What: Need to educate on what classifies as no rehire color: ff5630 Question: Will the rehire eligibility check be automatically applied based on term code And HR can override term code color Rehire eligibility is based of a auto complete rule, Users will have to select the correct rehire eligibility flag based on the action action reason. Otherwise they will get an error. HR will not be able to override

data.title: Separation Checklist TBD but standardized
data.description: Current: Not used for retail stores. More checklists for managers more in the form of PDF guidance Future: TBD can create eligibility profiles for the checklists so the separation checklist only applies to some populations when termination occurs So what: streamlined process for separation checklists

data.title: No Termination Approval for EE death
data.description: Current: Managers can enter death termination, and it goes to AEC. In corporate, HR enters it directly. Division HR also enters directly. Future: Set up a diff flow for the termination action to bypass approvals for an employee s death So what: more simple process to manage deceased employee

data.title: Involuntary Separations will happen via MSS for high volume and by HRBP for backstage
data.description: Current: Corporate process is outside of self service, managers send email to HR even though they have MSS Future: Managers in corporate to initiate involuntary separations or HR needs to take it as an action. We want to drive towards managers being able to initiate through self service So what: Extra step for managers Only a change for corporate because divisions can do it in the system. High volume, Manager initiates in Oracle, backstage, HRBP initiates in Oracle

data.title: Exit Survey Timing Standardized across divisions
data.description: Current: Divisions are doing it differently or not at all, timing is different Future: want to make this process consistent through Oracle still need to discuss timing after leaving the company, putting in resignation, etc. . This is limited to voluntary resignations TBD on timing So what: Data standardization and streamlined offboarding process

data.title: Submitting Resignation via ESS
data.description: Current: Employees in stores, division offices, and DCs submit resignation in person and in writing signed and with date Future: Employees will submit resignation in Oracle self service So what: Better data tracking, more convenient process since employees don t need to show up in person

data.title: Exit Survey sent through Oracle integrating with process
data.description: Current : Exit survey is sent manually there is no streamlined process for this, and not all divisions send an exit survey Future : Exit Survey will be sent through Oracle So what: removes a manual step from Division HR and data will be consistent across divisions Associate will like that the feedback is consistently captured and they re not filling out something separate

data.title: Comments are retained for 30 days on worklist items
data.description: Current: Comments HR puts in after approving a worklist item are never to be seen again Future: Oracle retains comments for 30 days So What: HR can go back and review comments

data.title: Initiating Job Changes via MSS for my store
data.description: Current: Store managers does it via MSS and then HR goes in and approves it Retail This may vary by division at Jewel Osco, the hourly store EE job comp change requests are submitted by the store s Personnel Coordinator and are routed to Division HR Specialist s worklist for approval or denial. Salaried EE job comp changes are submitted by Division HR Specialist. Future: MSS in Oracle So what: minimal change

data.title: Initiating Job Changes via MSS
data.description: Current: In Corporate, Manager initiates job changes, goes to AEC, then HR, and then generates a letter. HR updates in the backend. Everything is done through email. In Retail, manager submits the job change through Manager Self Service. This may vary by division at Jewel Osco, the hourly store EE job comp change requests are submitted by the store s Personnel Coordinator and are routed to Division HR Specialist s worklist for approval or denial. Salaried EE job comp changes are submitted by Division HR Specialist. Future: Manager will still consult with HR but will do the update in the system So what: Manager will have the extra step in the system

data.title: Resident Tax Address TBD
data.description: Current: Unknown Future: Question is how resident tax address is going to be updated. Will we use the mailing address So what: TBD

data.title: Demographic Fields are more specific
data.description: Current State: There is a current pain point for rehires, where their old value is listed as unknown, and the value they have selected both show up in reporting, where it reports no the old value. Currently, there is no choice to select 2 or more races as a value. Future State: Oracle will not pull an unknown value. There is potential to have more specific choices for race want to explore flex fields for diversity purposes so an employee can put in 2 or more races, and can break out Asian into more specific races. Additional flexfields. So what: Provide additional data on diversity while maintaining effective EEO reporting color: ff5630 Link decision ticket color

data.title: Notifications for Personal Data Changes TBD
data.description: Current: No notifications for approvals sent to the company requestor for name, address, email phone, emergency contact, marital status, disability, military changes Future: There will be notifications sent for approvals So What: Allows employee to know immediately that their approval is reflected

data.description: Current: Use Placeholder SSN for those on J1 visa, as it is required for Albertsons to pay the employee. Once the employee gets a regular SSN number, the wages are assigned to the correct SSN. Future: TBD SSN is not required out of the box in Oracle. So what: TBD

data.title: Store Directors will no longer be in the process of approving ee data changes
data.description: Current: Associates show the documentation for a data change to the store director, nothing is uploaded or stored anywhere for confidential info like Social Security Card Future: Records are uploaded by the ee to Oracle and Oracle erases them So What: For SD taking something off their plate

data.title: Personal data change verification of SSN for Legal Name Change DOB Change
data.description: Current: The employee submits the name change. Worklists to Store Director Manager then they verify the document visually and do not keep a copy. Then approve the worklist item. This is more of an in person process. Future: HR Site Support will initiate a SSN change directly in the Associate s personal data. The initiated request would route to the HRIS Specialist with no documentation attached, assuming validation happened onsite. So What: Makes this process more automated solves problem of store manager not doing approvals

data.title: Data Conversion Historical Data Access
data.description: Current: Historical compensation data is held in Peoplesoft HRSE . Future: Data will be archived in the PeopleSoft ecosystem, so it can be accessed for historical reasons TBD on the amount of data to be imported to oracle. Will be negative since the data is not consolidated together. So what: Oracle Cloud will be able to hold more recent data, with historical data being archived, so there will be no loss in data.

data.title: Potential collisions between new IDM solution Sailpoint HCM solutions going live in same general timeframe
data.description: From: JP Verma JP.Verma albertsons.com Sent: Tuesday, November 3, 2020 1:28 PM To: Anup Tomar Anup.Tomar albertsons.com Syed Rayadurg Syed.Rayadurg albertsons.com Romesh Santhiapillai Romesh.Santhiapillai albertsons.com Cc: Tj Lindberg Travis.Lindberg albertsons.com Sambuddha Ghosh Sambuddha.Ghosh albertsons.com Randy Thomas Randy.Thomas albertsons.com kwlaird kwlaird kpmg.com Sandip Kakani Sandip.Kakani albertsons.com Mike Episcopo Mike.Episcopo albertsons.com Helen Perez Helen.Perez albertsons.com Roby Gamboa Roby.Gamboa albertsons.com Ramamurthy, Guru Ragaventhiran gururagaventhiranram KPMG.com Subject: OPTIMUS HCM Transformation IDM Transition Importance: High Hi Anup Syed Romesh, As you might be aware on HCM Portfolio we have started on the OPTIMUS Phase 1 project where Employee system record Core HR is going to move from PeopleSoft HCM to Oracle HCM Cloud with the proposed go live Oct 2021. Based on said above with Optimus Phase 1: HCM Cloud will become the source for all Employee Contractor data changes PeopleSoft HCM will become downstream app to Oracle HCM Cloud and will Co Exists with Oracle HCM Cloud until Phase 2 proposed go live Jan 2023 As per my last call with Anup Tomar and Mike Episcopo separately I became aware that Identity platform is also going to be replaced with a new solution. With both PeopleSoft HCM and IDM platform on a transition path to new solutions. We would like to go through and understand how this is going to look in future in terms of integration and transition. I will setup a call to make sure we get aligned on this as discussion have started happening on Oracle HCM Cloud Security workstream. Please let me know who all needs to be invited from IDM Team Note: On Oracle Cloud both Finance and HCM use common security model and any changes to integrations will impact both sides of the house. KPMG CC ed is our system integration partner who is helping us implement the HCM Cloud solution.

If making it mandatory, they might be frustrated. THere are hiring managers where we struggle to get feedback at all. Big change in the way they interact with the system.

data.title: Email notification to interviewers when interview is scheduled
data.description: Current: Recruiter puts meeting invite on interviewer calendar Future: Interviewers receive automated email notification from Oracle So what: Intervieweres need to watch out for emails that may come rarely so they don t miss interviews

data.title: Candidates self schedule for interviews via Oracle
data.description: Current: Recruiter will go back and forth with candidate to schedule Future: Candidate will receive an email with opportunity to schedule interview based on times put in by the recruiter. Candidate will receive an email back with the confirmation and details for their scheduled interview So What: Less back and forth, easy of use, saves time. Recruiter can also request feedback on the candidate by the interviewer during this process

data.title: Standardization of compensation offer packages
data.description: Current: Different everywhere, but manual and reviewed by higher levels Future: TBD, will put as much into the system as possivle So what: less for recruiter to think about since the system would automate, allow for more consistency

data.title: Recruiter can accept offer on behalf of the candidate
data.description: Eliminate the step that the applicant has to accept the offer letter online. The recruiter has the option to accept it on behalf of the applicant So what: Better engagement to the applicant.

data.title: Offer letter will be sent for all roles
data.description: Current: Some places have offer letters, some don t, if there are they aren t standardized Future: Standardized offer letters will be sent for all roles. Recruiter will initiate in the system, hiring manager is notified when it goes out. Better engagement for candidate. So What: New standard of letter being sent for any job offer which will create better engagement for the candidate Potential for automation. Save time because system will create offer letter

data.title: Store Openings Process
data.description: TBD on future state

data.title: Preview Candidate resumes
data.description: Current: Have to download candidate resumes whenever you want to review Future: Ability to preview in Oracle rather than download So What: Improved speed in reviewing candidates

data.title: Education support models for requisitions will change
data.description: TBD on future state

data.title: Hiring Reports
data.description: Can put thresholds in place to view places to ensure compliance. Recruiters will use the seeded delivered reports. There aren t any custom hiring reports that available at least not yet.

data.title: Mobile capabilities for candidate application
data.description: Current: RM is not mobile enabled will be soon prior to Oracle launch Future: Candidates will be able to apply on phones So what: Candidates don t need computers, recruiters don t have to sit down with candidates in the store to help Current mobile is not easy to use but in Oracle it will be easy on mobile.

data.title: Rehire eligibility
data.description: Current: Need to contact HR to find rehire eligibility, often can take days or weeks so you lose candidates. Every division currently has a different workaround because RM does not do it automaticaly Future: TBD So what: TBD depending on new process, each division will have to learn the new process might be better or worse depending on division

data.title: Ability to view availability of high volume candidates
data.description: Current: Open a pdf of candidate application to view availabilty Future: TBD So what: be able to quickly see availability to select candidates Availability is important to everyone but biggest impact in Division SCM

data.title: Leadership will focus on strategy and insights and less tactical activities
data.description: Current: Leadership does recruiting Future: Remove leadership HRBP, Division HR from the weeds of recruiting to allow them the opportunity to focus on strategy based on data insights So what: Culture change, especially for those who grew up in grocery and are used to being in the weeds

data.title: Tracking candidates will automatically happen in Oracle
data.description: Current: Unable to track candidates in system, do it in excel Future: Oracle automaticall tracks candidates So What: Recruiter will spend Less time manually tracking in excel

data.title: Ability to send custom communications through Oracle
data.description: Current: RM allows communications to be sent to candidates using templates or recruiters can send emails to candidates for custom messaging. Candidate cannot respond in RM. Future: Can send template or custom communications to candidates and the communication is tracked in the application record. Candidate can respond and it is tracked in Oracle. So What: Communications are through the system as opposed to separate in an email Professional Recruiter has developed their own communications, so the challenge will be adoption.

data.title: Candidate needs to fully submit an application to be viewed in Oracle by TA
data.description: Current: Able to see all applications started in RM Future: Only able to view fully submitted applications by candidates So what: Only viewing candidates genuinely interested, but might miss potential candidates who did not click submit There will be a report 2562

data.title: Able to create reports in BI
data.description: Self service reporting capabilities allow for more efficient data analytics

data.title: Access to data reports will increase with automated reporting
data.description: Current: manually cobbling together data to make reports Future: Automatic reports are sent So what: Data will be incorporated into decision making

data.title: Knockout pre screen assessment questions on an application
data.description: Current: Lots of questions on application, but no way for RM to automatically knockout or filter out specific candidates, that is done manually by the recruiter Future: Using pre screening questions, Oracle can automatically filter out unqualified candidates So what: Store teams will only do final talent selection onboarding for entry level roles to make a faster, more efficient process Note: Recruiters will have difficulty trusting the system knockout questions and might spend time going back through dispositioned candidates just in case .

data.title: New hire, pending to active worker training assignment
data.description: Work with recruiting core hr to determine best way to configure learning initiative. From: Weiwei Yap Weiwei.Yap albertsons.com Sent: Wednesday, October 28, 2020 4:22 PM To: Mackie, Alex alexandermackie KPMG.com Cc: Angela Villaceran Angela.Villaceran albertsons.com Subject: EXTERNAL HCM Learning: Pending Hired Worker Hi Alex, A topic came up during Recruiting validation workshop, regarding converting pending to hired worker only on Day 1 when worker shows up. KPMG s advice to this is to alleviate some pain points today relating to onboarding for recruiters, eg. if worker was hired but never showed up. Will this affect Learning, especially if courses are already assigned for example Are courses assigned prior to or after hired Thanks, Weiwei Hey Weiwei, This is a good question. We should connect with recruiting to review employee data as they are transferred from a pending to active employee. This will allow us to determine the most efficient way to assign new hire training Some thoughts: If the employee has a Person ID as a pending worker, we can still assign training Would it make sense to try applying an assignment rule to this employee status field So that when an employee switches from pending to active, they would be assigned required new hire training. Something that would require testing, and we would want to connect with recruiting to confirm this field. I m creating a JIRA ticket to further track this conversation. I know we are deep in validation workshops right now, but when things calm down we shoot probably meet on this topic. Thanks, Alex Mackie Senior Associate, Advisory alexandermackie kpmg.com 805 886 3623 accountid:5f7f140ae31b69006fdf014e accountid:5a67a91a4e6fa32306362384 accountid:5f43e22cfcaf93003bed3271 accountid:5b521370845e7e2cdff7758a

data.title: Career Site Configuration in Oracle and having Job requisition URL in reports to share with third party vendors
data.description: Candidates profiles are not captured in our current career website so there will be no candidates to be added to the system. What we envision with the Oracle integration candidates will continue to search view our jobs through our current career website but continue their journey into Oracle to create their candidate profile application for the job they selected. Stand up event campus recruiting will go through Oracle s career website. I m not sure yet though if this is formally confirmed. Adding Tim here for any additional input. Also, although our Manila employees data are in PeopleSoft, they are not currently recruited onboarded through our career site ADP RM. Currently Albertsons Careers Website is just a search site for jobs it does not hold any sort of applicant data. If a candidate decides to apply for a job, he she is routed to ADP RM to start the application process. ADP RM publishes an XML that contains all active job requisitions including the URL that points directly to the job requisition on the ADP RM site on a scheduled basis this is what the Albertsons Careers Website and the other third party search sites that the company has business with consume to keep the data current. Does OCR have a similar way of exporting job requisition data to third party external search sites

data.title: Retention Bonus Requirements
data.description: Retention Bonuses are offered to employees in the US, Canada and Philippines and 3 options will be configured to support this: Retention Bonus US Retention Bonus CA Retention Bonus PH This plan will function as an ad hoc compensation award. A series of future dated payments will be awarded to existing employees upon accepting the terms and conditions of the Retention Bonus offer letter. Retention Bonus Candidates will be identified and the process will be initiated by the HRBP. Approval process if Retention Award is less than 20,000: HRBP to initiate with one level of approval routed to HR Leader Area of Responsibility Approval process if Retention Award is greater than or equal to 20,000: HRBP Comp Managers EVP or Division President The Retention Bonus Offer letter should be included as part of the approval process. Upon acceptance, the offer letter will need to get stored in the employee s document of records. There are currently two versions of the Offer Letter one for California employees which includes a clause for LOA and the other for non California employees The terms and conditions of the offer letter will be decided offline. This includes the payment amount, number of installments, amount paid in each installment and the date of payment for each installment. If the employee is a resident of california and has been on an LOA, they will receive a prorated share of the payment based on the weeks worked

data.title: Failure to map all ODBC Open Database Connection or custom databases results in missing reports or analytics to conduct effective operations
data.description: sent to team on 10 1 20 Good evening, 25837 HCM Transformation just wanted to ensure that everyone is aware that if you or anyone in your organization is reliant on an unsupported aka bootleg database connection to PeopleSoft such as a Microsoft Access Database connection YOUR FEED WILL DISAPPEAR IN 2021 no reports, nothing... . To mitigate this risk, please contact me or Sandip Kakani no later than EOD on10 31 20 to inform us that you require an ODBC connection to support your business operations. Just so you are aware, the HR IT team has SOME visibility into what is happening with ODBC connections in Naini Mandala s AEC, but we have ZERO visibility on what is happening at the division level or out in the field so this risk is especially pertinent for you . AEC teammates please review update the attached spreadsheet. We will automatically assume anything not accessed in 2020 will BE GOING AWAY IN MAY 2021. Please update the spreadsheet and or reach out to me or Sandip Kakani before EOD on 10 31 20.

data.title: BLOCKED: Migrating ALA dashboards to Loki OSS in Non prod Logs are Stopped to Loki OSS from APIM Logs
data.description: Hi Team, We are currently migrating from APIM exporter to Streaming for supply chain and pharmacy. We have 30 app codes to convert from KQL to LQL, and the conversion is going well. However, we need to start validating the data for each app code against the existing dashboard metrics. We require APIM logs to validate the data otherwise, this will be a blocker for us. We have been unable to access the logs from 7:15 AM IST until now, and we are currently blocked. data.title: 1. Missing Azure Streaming solution implementation for applicable exporters 2. Missing customer sign offs in Non PROD led to customer escalations, resulting in additional efforts for APM on the redeployments
data.description: No non prod change requests were planned for critical exporter upgrades, leading to customer escalation see attached from StoneBranch . The customer is concerned about why non production changes were made without a change request. Due to this escalation, the APM team has to schedule non prod change requests to secure official sign off from the impacted application teams. We learned that the Azure Streaming solution is already available for Azure Metrics BLOB SQL Exporter. Therefore, instead of upgrading those exporters, Azure Streaming needs to be enabled in Non PROD as well. This was not done by the Ingestion team in the last PIs, despite the Product team communicating the critical priority of Azure Streaming solution implementation in PI3 PI4. Due to this oversight, APM had to cancel exporter upgrade deployments for ref EOP 16276 CHG0698204 Upgrade Azure Metric Exporter BLOB from Grafana agent to Grafana Alloy Risk : Low Safeway JIRA https: jira.safeway.com browse EOP 16276 jql project 20 3D 20EOP 20AND 20labels 20in 20 ESOB CR FY2024 PI4 2C 20ESOB CR 2025 20AND 20 key 20in 20 EOP 16266 2CEOP 16276 EOP 16266 CHG0698203 Upgrade Azure Metric Exporter SQL from Grafana agent to Grafana Alloy Risk : Low Safeway JIRA https: jira.safeway.com browse EOP 16266 jql project 20 3D 20EOP 20AND 20labels 20in 20 ESOB CR FY2024 PI4 2C 20ESOB CR 2025 20AND 20 key 20in 20 EOP 16266 2CEOP 16276 and coordinate with the App Owners to onboard Azure Streaming in both Non PROD and PROD environments for the exporters where the Azure Streaming solution is available. The team is currently comparing metrics availability, dashboards, and alerts used by the app teams that need to be migrated, which will require additional time. For reference: Metric Availability Azure Streaming Metrics Exporter Azure SQL DB ESOB Albertsons Confluence https: confluence.safeway.com pages viewpage.action spaceKey ESOB title Azure SQL DB https: confluence.safeway.com display ESOB Azure Blob Storage Streaming There may be additional exporters where the Azure Streaming solution is already available but was not implemented at the exporter level. Event Hub Streaming Solution Implementation Status ESOB Albertsons Confluence https: confluence.safeway.com display ESOB Event Hub Streaming Solution Implementation Status Due to this oversight, there is a delay of two sprints, and the APM team needs to redeploy in Non PROD to mitigate the issue

data.title: Metrics collector Upgrade delay
data.description: Problem Statement steps taken so far : Erroneous metric values for Pod CPU utilization were reported by PHI team on non prod environment. Upon investigation it was found to replicate on other clusters as well. On Shared clusters, the issue seemed to stem after the cluster upgrade activities. A restart of the metrics collector component was done the values reported on the metrics were back to expected. On PHI cluster, the values were seen to have fixed after disabling clustering for the cadvisor component. This is a change from the planned configurations for the metrics collector upgrade. Hence the planned changes were placed on hold. As a background check the values of clustering enablement match the values from what are referred from Grafana repository. A ticket has been raised to Grafana team for seeking assistance on this deviation in behavior.

data.title: ORWELL : If Implement Short Term Solution: 15 minute latency
data.description: Hi MPALA65 , Thanks for setting up the follow up call to go through the Architecture Solution review. Just would like to add some important call outs on the foresee risks we brought to your attention if we go ahead with the proposed short term solution. Short term solution: Ricky Rorres will consolidate all logs from all 2200 stores at every 15 mins into a single text file and Grafana Alloy agent will scrap these logs and sends them to Grafana Loki. Potential Risk: 15 minute latency: As mentioned, there will be a 15 minute latency, meaning the logs will not be in real time according to the proposed short term solution For tracking purposes, I have logged this in Jira under your ownership.

data.title: ORWELL Short Term Solution Single point of failure
data.description: Hi MPALA65 , Thanks for setting up the follow up call to go through the Architecture Solution review. Just would like to add some important call outs on the foresee risks we brought to your attention if we go ahead with the proposed short term solution. Short term solution: Ricky Rorres will consolidate all logs from all 2200 stores at every 15 mins into a single text file and Grafana Alloy agent will scrap these logs and sends them to Grafana Loki. data.title: BLOCKER: Non PROD Scaling up Loki SaaS Loki ingestor crashed due to a high volume of spike scaping old app logs CHG0677332
data.description: After deploying the configuration file We are sending Logs to Loki OSS Loki SAAS also , Loki ingestor crashed due to a high volume of spike, as it didn t have the capacity to handle the load. Platform team deleted POD to have Loki OSS back on the track. This issue was related to capacity problem in the no prod environment . Discussed with senthil and below solutions were identified to resolve the above issue : 1. Increase the ingested pod in loki OSS for couple hours to increase the capacity and we can scale down the pods after the testing. 2.Reduce the log volume as this is in no prod environment. We will have obtain approval from Hari s team Integration Services to remove the older logs . 3. Just send the logs to cloud saas .But this will not be the same config that we will be implementing in prod. 4.Test the position file which implies the markup of logs that are already read by the agent.This has to be tested. We plan to go forward with item 1 2 and need your approval for the scaling up of ingesters that involves increase in cost.

data.title: Ingestion PI3 scope creep
data.description: We ve scope creep in the form of following features. Traces collector Initial commitment for PI3 is to rollout new trace collector with alloy shared01 and BA2 clusters only. But as per Senthil s suggestion we need to continue the roll out to rest of the clusters, since the application teams started using the traces already. This is a scope creep for us. Payments Kafka Observability This is totally a new feature added in the middle of the PI due to high priority ask from the application team. This is also a scope creep. AKS Observability Standardization This is an ask from DevOps to support on the validations. Ingestion team to do validations on perf and prod environment for 40 clusters. This will require significant amount of efforts to be spent. This is again a scope creep for us. Metrics collector for BA2 This is a new priority task from Merchandising team to fix the high memory utilization issue. Team is working to provide a permanent fix, with in this PI. This is to avoid issues during the holiday season.

data.title: Blocker Grafana v11.x upgrade: Viewer access with custom role permissions unable to create modify alerts
data.description: Issue Detail: Users with Viewer access and custom role permissions to alerts are unable to create or modify alerts after Grafana v11 upgrade in Perf environment. RCA: Users are getting plugin proxy route access denied error when trying to create alerts. Need to work with Grafana team to debug the issue and provide solution. Next Step: Open Grafana support ticket In Progress Gopal We will try to test with 1 version and see if we are getting similar errors. Impact: This is a critical blocker to the planned Grafana prod migration, as the alert creation for viewer users not functioning. Grafana Ticket 150204 opened. Albertsons Companies Inc Ticket Details: Grafana 11.1.3 DataSource Alert plugin proxy route access denied issues Grafana Labs https: grafana.com orgs albertsons tickets 150204 User reported issue: EOP 11484 getting error plugin proxy route accces denied when saving alert rule in observability perf Safeway JIRA

data.title: AKS Alloy multi PI work due complexity and additional time needed for testing
data.description: Alloy testing issues: Complexity of testing efforts increased after deploying Alloy in AKS for testing, multiple stages fine tuning based on detailed testing of tracecollector and k8collector In Progress Node exporter: Network metric values are not matching. Raised a ticket in Alloy Github Open but not critical issue https: github.com grafana alloy issues 1224 Communication between Load Balancer alloy and Sampler Alloy is failing in BA2 and other ESOB shared clusters. However ESOB shared01 cluster it is working fine. Helm chart fix applied 6 days effort Issue Fixed on 07 17 K8attributes values are missing now Issue Fixed on 07 23 Alloy Logs: Not all self Alloy logs are getting pushed to Loki. Raised a ticket to Alloy Github Temporary solution changes Inprogress until github community provides fix . https: github.com grafana alloy issues 1225 Ashwini key developer LDAP ID expired, work blocked for 3 days from 07 18 07 22 Closed Components: K8 Collector for node metrics, self logs, self metrics In progress, observed multiple issues during testing in ESOB cluster Trace Collector for traces In Progress, observed multiple issues during testing in ESOB cluster Kubestate metrics with Alloy for Application metric Replace Prometheus with Alloy. POC not started, no bandwidth available Alloy to be deployed in below AKS clusters 1.TRU BA, ESOB 2.PHI 3.PCI 4.RES Efforts and Issues K8 Collector POC: Incorporated Node Exporter, Cadvisor, Alloy self metrics logs Observed Alloy inbuilt self metrics are not exposing key labels Cadvisor: Analysed existing setup and found, Cadvisor metrics are scraped from Kubelet s Cadvisor, not from standalone Cadvisor running as daemonset Cadvisor: Stopped standalone Cadvisor and validated if metrics are still visible in Grafana Node Exporter: Compared Alloy inbuilt Node exporter values with existing standalone Node exporter values, observed CPU, Memory, disk metric values are matching, however Network metric values are not matching. Raised a ticket in Alloy Github Logs: Observed not all self alloy logs are getting pushed to Loki. After further analysis, raised a ticket to Alloy Github Helmchart: Helmchart update and validation is in progress Alloy Traces: Alloy config fine tuning and validation with sample java app was completed Helmchart standardization review with Senthil has been completed and handed over the manifest to Devops for Helmchart update for Aksshared 01 and BA2 Nonprod cluster 5 to 6 days effort Deployed in BA2 and observed traces are not flowing into Tempo. Observed communication between Load Balancer alloy and Sampler Alloy is failing. Tried multiple config changes, able to push traces directly from loadbalancer alloy however, not with Loadbalancer Sampler alloy combination Observed same issue in aksshared 02, 03 cluster however same config was working in aksshared 01 cluster Tried helm changes provided by Senthil and able to get Traces in Tempo 6 days effort However k8attributes values are missing now analysis is in progress Aswhini Ldap id expired so far lost 2 days Helmchart update for BA2, Java app helmchart pipeline creation 3 to 4 days Span metrics Service Graphs POC in progress

data.title: Sitescope Monitoring Execute python scripts from GHA for check, alerts creation
data.description: Background: Currently there are python scripts available for check creation, Alert rule creation, checks backup, etc.. These python scripts take csv as input and call grafana api by passing bearer token as authentication and execute it. By end of the python script, it generates output csv which needs to be stored Ask to Devops We need a workflow file where it runs through GitHub runner, get Api key from secrets and able to copy from output csv to local repository Devops responds Devops team has provided a repo for reference and create workflow file for our scenario. Challenges expected: We can t keep the code in our repository directly rather need to go through GHA team for script review and get permission to create branch in the central workflow repository Workflow reference provided by devops can t be used directly. Need to create a new workflow which matches our requirement

data.title: Scope Creep OPEX Cost impact due to Tempo Scaling : Trace Onboarding without Intake process
data.description: Problem Statement Scope Creep: We are discovering that teams are implementing and planning Changes to send traces to the Observability platform in Production without notifying the Observability team. The ESOB platform has limited capacities and have a requirement for App teams to submit Intake Forms. This process allows us to ensure the Observability Platform has sufficient capacity and allows us to allocate resources to support the onboarding process. Cost impact Shared 02 in prod currently running with 13 nodes and we are expecting approximately 8 to 13 nodes added due to this changes. Assuming the higher end 13 additional nodes of standard sku will cost 13 750 9750 for each month without considering enterprise discount. Mitigation Plan Teams to follow the onboarding protocol. To mitigate the issue, below is the plan: Following is the plan for addressing the current issues with the Tempo enablement for EPE and other teams. 1 Deploy Tempo with baselined configuration with 5 percent scaling which can support upto 150K spans second which can support their load without any problem 5 8 2 Upgrade Tempo and move Tempo to shard05 cluster ETA 5 30 a. Upgrade tempo to 2.4.x has TraceQL performance improvements and better caching b. Shared02 we are seeing some issues within cluster and being it is small cluster with Ingestion pods are in it would be good to move to shared05 this requires DNS switch to common url and possibly 30 1 hour outage. 3 Change to trace ingestion AKS monitoring solution ETA 5 10 if feasible This will further reduce volume of traces ingested and provides more stable backend a. Tail sampling changes b. Drop traces based on app code so that we can enforce onboarding process We might need to prioritize this activities with all groups of ESOB.

data.title: SiteScope to Synthetic Monitoring: Support on the issues for already migrated apps
data.description: Problem Statement: Few consumers are reporting issues for already migrated apps. Identify the ownership who can support those issues as its consuming APM engineers time to investigate and triage the issues. screenshot 1.png thumbnail Resolution: There have been instances of application downtime, network packet loss, and network connection issues. We observed in the Jira URL that the synthetic monitoring agent was unable to connect with the Jira URLs. In the Grafana DataSource Explore, we selected the date time and saw that the active probe was not successful. screenshot below for reference. screenshot 2.png thumbnail Similarly, in Artifactory, we went through the debug to identify the issue and found that it was also not able to reach out. This might be due to several reasons, such as the application URL being down or network connection issues. However, as confirmed, the application URL is working. If you see the same kind of alerts, we need to involve the network team to find more about the connections. screenshot 3.png thumbnail

data.title: Unavailability of consumable Alert channel integrations for Teams, PD, SNOW
data.description: Grafana SaaS Alert integration capability needs to provide Direct Integration with 4 channels at a minimum Email, Pager Duty, Microsoft Team, and Service Now . Plus SMS Text should be available. Based on the approved BRD, ABS team is led to believe these integration exist but subsequent meetings with Grafana SaaS team reveals that another product OnCall is available for ABS to work with to develop and or enhance current limited capability offered by Grafana. The BRD indicates these integrations are available and ready to consume. This does not seem to be the case with significant amount of build, test work that ABS may have to undertake. For short term 90 days , using Grafana Universal Alert Manager will support and suffice for low volumes. But as soon as the volumes of logs and metrics increase, over next few months, robust existing integrations with Teams, SNOW, and other channels will need to be available to maintain to the program milestones timelines. At present, unavailability of robust and direct alert integrations to channels is a HUGE RISK to the program s delivery timeline.

data.title: MQ: Regex filter not enabled in nastel APIs to split volume to manage load
data.description: MQ Nastel: Regex not enabled in below nastel monitoring API filter to split the volume between retail and backstage to manage the load. monitoring mqi stats monitoring channel stats monitoring queue stats Risk : New Nastel MQ API doesn t have regex filter to split the volume on ESOB side when ingesting the data. Mitigation Plan : 1 Based on current prod volume assessment expected data from 50K queues generate 4M active series , one pod can handle the ingestion. 2 Worst case scenario: In case volume from MQ is increased, pod may fail and restart every 5hours in ESOB. Queue related data 2 metrics will not be ingested into ESOB and will not be available on Grafana for FaR expectation set to FaR team . 3 Discussed with platform team and confirmed platform can handle this volume and incase pod fails due to high volume and restarts, it will not impact the ESOB platform. Next Step : We can proceed with exporter deployment in ESOBF prod, need to keep a watch on MQ volume and pod health until regex filter change is implemented. Note: Deployment is only on ESOB nodes, no deployment on MQ side. MQ team is ok with us to move forward with deployment, their Nastel API is available in prod. added Himanshu as approver in the CR .

data.title: Data is not getting written to azure storage account using Pyroscope storage config
data.description: We ve configured Pyroscope to use Azure Blob Storage bucket for long term storage, by setting the following in it s config map: storage: azure: account key: account name: container name: endpoint suffix: blob.core.windows.net backend: azure We are running Pyroscope in microservice mode. All pods distributor, ingester, store gateway, querier, query scheduler and query frontend are running, data is not getting flushed to storage. We do not see any error logs for data not getting flushed to azure storage.

data.title: Enterprise AKS metrics enablement blocked due to Kube State metrics not working
data.description: There is high risk, for AKS enterprise metrics enablement. Some of the AKS metrics which has stopped working due to unavailability of Kube state metrics. This has impact in both non prod and prod. As we are using this service to scrape the container node metrics, this is blocking for even filtering at node pools and namespace level. Probable suspicion is the recent upgrade happened to Kube state metrics Or Any cluster level upgrade effecting it This is a complete blocker for us to enable the AKS metrics and alerts. We need Giovanni mailto:Giovanni.Cuadro albertsons.com team s support to clear this blocker, by enabling the Kube state metrics. As part of Thanos migration, we need to bring all Prometheus dependencies into ESOB platform which covers this Kube state metrics as well.

data.title: Unable to migrate Log Analytics to Loki due to delay in Prometheus deployment and Namespace creation
data.description: Few minutes back we encountered a Critical Risk due to which it is stopping us to deliver EOP 4800 Migrate ESOB Log Analytics to Loki feature in this PI2 what we committed earlier. This Risk is on DevOps as ESOB namespace for all clusters for which Promtail deployment was required is not yet done and also DevOps to have PROD ESOB namespace created. We only have a week to have this PROD deployment done for all 4 clusters that means we would need to have 4 CRs completed to complete the validation before Moratorium. We had High confidence on this delivery however due to this show stopper issue in the ESOB Namespace I am afraid if we can deliver this in PI2.

data.title: Pharmacy APIM : Deploying exporters in Pharmacy namespaces is blocked due to budget constraints and audit issue
data.description: Creating a new GHE Repo for helm and CD pipeline. Just one repo is required which is not specific to any appcode. As per standards from Platform team, we can t create a repo without Appcode name, this will come under audit issue. In AKS, Pharmacy services applications are deployed under namespace. Right now, the services which are specific to appcode are deployed under the namespace of that appcode, for eg, appcode env like rxwa dev, rxwa qa2 . We don t have any common AKS namespace which can be used here. Also raising a RIT for AKS namespace, we need an appcode We just can t deploy the pods under any appcode, which will become an audit issue again when we deploy non appcode pods under an appcode specific namespace. We are working towards cost optimization where we are reducing the pods which are not required and given these new pods will increase the budget for an appcode. We also need to get an approval from the stakeholders of that appcode for deploying these pods.

data.title: Delay in getting SME support from MQ MIM IIB
data.description: We would like to discuss in detail with you about below potential risk impediments for MQ MIM IIB L2 ingestion progress and next step 1 For MQ, MIM IIB, we requested below additional details from Dave to explore and understand their logs better to build L2 metrics. However, per chat with Dave, he doesn t have bandwidth to support at this deeper level. Details about logs being pushed into log analytics log structures, field mapping Keywords or strings to search in the log for MQ MIM IIB metrics and status errors trace monitoring DB MySQL structure and access to understand file transfer status, error messages etc. List of metrics to be monitored for these systems Mitigation plan: To be discussed. For IIB, we got another contact from JP, we setup a meeting with him tomorrow For now, for MQ MIM we will analyze the logs provided to us and get some understanding. 2 Need to assess if this is a risk MIM stores file transfer details in logs and detailed status error messages in MySQL DB. However there is no secondary for this DB, its standalone with no replication enabled. Dave is unsure if there is secondary DB setup, he will check with offshore and get back to us. Querying detailed metrics from SQL DB may lead to DB performance issues and deadlock, so per discussion with JP we will explore the data available in log analytics and design feasible dashboards.

data.title: APIM Performance Difference between Prod and Non Prod
data.description: Here are details around the performance difference that we are seeing between Prod and Non Prod. Please go through it and share your thoughts and we would like to discuss in detail during our connect tomorrow. 4 Instances of APIM in Prod with around 100K requests shows 22 capacity whereas 600K request in NonProd APIM shows 40 capacity even with just 1 instance Throughput of AppGW in Prod is 3.5MB s whereas Non Prod is 210MB s Below tables shows data taken for last few days and overall Prod with high instance count seems to be utilizing more capacity for lower load than how it performs in Non Prod

data.title: Alert Manager duplicating notifications
data.description: Alert manager pods are duplicating notifications. Both pods appear to be sending the same notification messages instead of auto de duplicating. EIOT team requires only 1 message be sent per alert event for auto healing process to function correctly. Currently the only way to have this work properly is to set pod replicas to 1. This is a risk as we require multiple pods to be available for High Availability purposes.

data.title: ARES Grafana Replacement Dependencies
data.description: 4th April 2024: Team is coordinating with Cindy Flowers to complete the packaging and to run the scripts. Currently the team is also occupied with other priority initiatives. 8 Jan: Until these dependencies are cleared we couldn t start the development of this, BRD finalization: Jeff is still working on finalizing the BRD, the scope is still not confirmed whether we are going only with Command Control or including Self healing and Monitoring. 2. Access Privilege for the EIOT system account: Sandhya Sandala Contractor is working with Cindy and George for linux and Hugo for Window 3. Design approach Edge based vs Cloud based : We initially proposed edge based approach, but JP wants to keep the option open for cloud based as well. For Cloud based, we need to open the firewall from AKS subnet to all the RISE stack servers. We had few challenges in getting the Firewall approval earlier for other use cases from Infosec, anyways we will create new RIT for this and check. We are having challenge in getting the IP ranges for this, Akshay K Sangma Contractor would check with Sergio and create the needed RITs. Below are the pros and cons of both approaches Edge Based D Server Cloud Based AKS Overview Edge based remote command capability by having our IoT agent running on each stores D server. From EIOT platform we can perform the remote operations thru this IoT agent which in turn executes the command inside store network. Pods running in AKS, directly connects SSH or WinRM to each of the RISE stack servers for Command Control Request Periodic Monitoring Possible by having the IoT agent to check the status of each servers on the Stores every 30 or 60min once. Periodic monitoring of 25K servers from few Pods will have scalability issues Availability Remote command and control is performed through D server, if D server not available for any reason, the solution looses its capability. AKS is highly available. Performance High Performance possible as the commands are distributed to the each store edge agent Less effective Scalability Solution can scale for the increasing number of servers to be controlled Not scalable

data.title: Meraki API Throttling Issue Awaiting Resolution from ESOB
data.description: Duplicate ticket. Tracked via AUT 534 Link Negotiation Status Check Meraki API Issue and ESOB validation Safeway JIRA 24 Mar: Ashwini checking with Kashyap for prioritizing this 14 Mar: ARAMA25 to get help on the ETA from ESOB team 13 Mar: CHG0503863 Disable Enable meraki exporter in esobf prometheus scrape configuration Executed. ESOB team to come up the plan on Network API optimization. Prioritization and timeline to be shared by Senthil. Update from ESOB if we disable the network scope calls we are able to run the Link Negotiation usecases and the largest org took nearly 30 minutes to complete.So we can plan something between 30m 1 hr as our scrape interval. Now the color: de350b challenge is to identify the API for network scope color which can eliminate the use of current API and reduce the number of calls made by network scope or how to color: de350b oprimize the existing network scope api calls. color 7 Mar: CHG0503863 created by ESOB team to Disable Enable meraki exporter in esobf prometheus scrape configuration CHG Approved and Scheduled on 10 Mar We are anticipating delays from ESOB on the resolution for the Meraki API Limitation, as they are held up with critical PROD Deployments. This impacts the planned deployment of Link Negotiation usecase. Current Plan of Action: ESOB to plan for performing this analysis by stopping the exporter in prod. If the exporter is found to be the culprit, do we plan to do optimization on the consumption. The timeline it would take. If optimization is not possible, alternate option Meraki said they cannot increase rate limit. We cannot move further on this use case without addressing this API rate limit issue.

data.title: WATCH OUT :: New Team members in a POD
data.description: Description: One of the significant risks associated with the PI deliverables is that several team members are new to the pod, and they lack familiarity with the pod s specific processes and dynamics. This lack of experience within the pod can lead to various challenges and potential setbacks to PI 3 Activities. Potential Impact: Delayed Onboarding: New team members require additional time to adapt to the pod s practices and expectations, potentially delaying PI tasks and milestones. Reduced Productivity: Initially, new members may be less productive as they get acclimated to the pod, impacting the overall team s efficiency. Mitigation Strategies: Comprehensive Onboarding: Implementing structured onboarding process for new pod members, including orientation sessions, access to relevant documentations, systems, and introductions to key team members. Mentorship: Assign experienced pod members as mentors to new team members, providing guidance and support as they integrate into the pod. Regular Check Ins: Conducting regular meetings to gauge the progress and comfort level of new team members within the pod. Training and Skill Development: Offering KT sessions focused on the pod s activities processes and tools to expedite the learning curve.

We cannot ask for System Id s as our application is using Dataflow jobs which will use GCP Service Users which are IAM users in the cloud and we do not have fixed Linux Windows users to use. data.title: Placement of EDM table with PII on GCP Projects
data.description: From: Raj Jha Contractor Raj.Jha albertsons.com Date: Thursday, June 1, 2023 at 8:54 AM To: Aparna Badrinath Aparna.Badrinath albertsons.com Cc: Bhuvan Padakanti Bhuvan.Padakanti albertsons.com , Shweta Hegde Shweta.Hegde albertsons.com , Balasivakumar Murugesan Balasivakumar.Murugesan albertsons.com , Deepika Shanmugam Deepika.Shanmugam albertsons.com , Ravichandran Sangili Ravichandran.Sangili albertsons.com , Saji Joseph Saji.Joseph albertsons.com , Vinay Desai Vinay.Desai albertsons.com , Rajiv Vipani Rajiv.Vipani albertsons.com Subject: RE: GCP framework Snowflake to BigQuery Hi Aparna, As you know, we need 11 EDM tables in the Health Data Lake until the GCP UDP databases are available with these tables. The approach we had decided to follow was wo use the existing GCP Framework that is used by Albertsons teams to move data from EDM to GCP GCP Project gcp abs eddw prod prj 01 and then use authorized views to share them with HDL Project. We just realized that 1 out of these 11 tables contains PII data and we are doubtful if we can move this table EDM VIEWS PRD.DW VIEWS.SMV RETAIL CUSTOMER LOYALTY PROGRAM HOUSEHOLD containing PII data in a tokenized form in the GCP Project gcp abs eddw prod prj 01 This GCP project is not part of the UDP setup and exists already and does not currently have any table containing PII. We wanted to understand where we can have this table in GCP until UDP is available. Thanks, Raj

data.title: Memory not releasing for PCF containers in ospk services in AcuPick West
data.description: We have been noticing that ospk services for the last 7 days have not been scaling up or down along with the load that the application is receiving. From our observations the auto scaler is not scaling back down because the memory being consumed is above the threshold. This is the number of containers for the last seven days image 2023 08 31 16 13 12 111.png width 439,height 276 This is the load recorded from the go router logs for the last seven days. image 2023 08 31 16 13 58 834.png width 701,height 205 We also notice that the heap usage remains under 90 . We also see this configuration for the JVM: Xmx2951M image 2023 08 31 16 14 58 702.png width 685,height 264 Please consider revising the JVM setting as this is causing unnecessary cost if the auto scaler does not scale down during off peak hours.
